title: CA licensed clinical psychologist for remote autism evaluation
description:
Jigsaw Diagnostics is a telehealth provider improving child and family outcomes by increasing access to timely evaluations and support for autism and other neurobehavioral conditions. Families can be seen in a matter of days by a licensed clinical psychologist, and provided with a full diagnostic report and personalized care plan. Follow-up consultations address questions, concerns, and next steps. Our unique approach reduces time, cost, and burden without sacrificing quality. A private and secure evaluation at home, where children feel most comfortable, gives families the answers they need when they need them most.

We are seeking licensed clinical psychologists who have experience with telehealth diagnostic autism assessments for children to join our growing team. Doctorate in Clinical Psychology, either PsyD or PhD from an APA accredited program, as well as completion of an APA accredited internship required. Candidates should have training and experience with the ADOS Modules 1-3 and Toddler and CARS-2 with the ability to transition these observational/facilitative skills to a telehealth format. Other important skills include:

* Ability to build rapport and navigate complexities of telehealth appointment
* Being a self-starter and able to work independently to meet deadlines and work collaboratively with other team members to help build and refine the internal processes of a telehealth platform.
* Ability to complete remote/telehealth diagnostic evaluations, provide feedback to families
* Ability to write diagnostic reports, providing treatment and other resource recommendations.
* Licensed to practice in California

Non-mandatory but preferred qualifications include:

* Credentialed with CAQH or other national organizations
* Member of PsyPact
* Credentialed with Medi-CAL
* Physically resides in California
* Fluency in Spanish

Availability may be on a full or part-time basis, likely a fee per evaluation compensation arrangement to start. Company offers appointments Monday-Friday 8am-5pm pacific time.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Pay: $130,000.00 - $180,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Remote
* Telehealth

Application Question(s):

* Do you currently live in California?

Education:

* Doctorate (Required)

Experience:

* ADOS testing: 1 year (Required)
* Autism diagnosis: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* California Psychology license (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Psychologist – Army Wellness Program, Part time
description:
*Hyperion Biotechnology, Inc. has been providing services to federal government customers for over 20 years. Our customers receive comprehensive services to meet the specified requirements of their projects. With strong leadership and corporate infrastructure, Hyperion offers support and solutions to ensure the successful execution of our customers' programs.*

 **Title:** Psychologist - Army Wellness Program, Part Time

**Location: Remote within the Continental United States**

**Job Summary**


Hyperion Biotechnology is seeking candidates for a part time Psychologist to support the US Army's Wellness Program for the Army Criminal Investigation Division. The Psychologist will be responsible for conducting psychological evaluations for psychological fitness for duty evaluations.

**Responsibilities/Tasks**

* Conducting virtual psychological evaluations, consisting of psychological testing and clinical interview, of Civilian Special Agent applicants and civilian Special Agents who require psychological fitness for duty evaluations. The process for which these are conducted are guided by DACID policy.

**Minimum Requirements**

* Must be a Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PhD or PsyD) with a Doctoral degree from an accredited graduate program.
* Must have a valid unrestricted license from a State, the District of Columbia, a U.S. Commonwealth, or a U.S. Territory that grants authority to provide counseling services as an independent practitioner.
* Must be able to practice at the independent level without requiring state mandated clinical supervision and demonstrate a working knowledge of professional standards and ethics.
* Must have provided documented proof of professional liability insurance of at least $1,000,000 per occurrence; $3,000,000 aggregate.
* Must have a minimum of six years of full-time professional experience post-licensure.
* Must understand law enforcement, as well as the military lifestyle and culture. Basic knowledge of the military population (e.g., prior work with the VA, having clients who were/are military) are acceptable forms of experience.

Must be able to effectively communicate with individuals and groups of diverse backgrounds, including enlisted personnel, officers, and senior military and civilian leadership.  
* 

  

**Hyperion is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law. You may self-identify on a voluntary basis.**

*No question on this application is intended to secure information to be used for such discrimination. The company is required by federal regulations to report information as requested on the form. Your contribution of this information is completely voluntary and in no way affects the decision regarding your employment opportunity. The information you provide is strictly confidential.*

title: Therapist
description:
Job Summary:

Trimble Therapy, LLC is a private practice dedicated to providing compassionate and effective therapy services to individuals struggling with eating disorders, trauma, and anxiety. Our team is committed to delivering evidence-based treatment and personalized care to empower clients on their journey to recovery and expand access to treatment.

Trimble Therapy is seeking a passionate and experienced Eating Disorder Therapist to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in treating individuals with eating disorders, such as anorexia nervosa, bulimia nervosa, binge eating disorder, and other related conditions. The therapist will provide individual therapy sessions, conduct assessments, develop treatment plans, and collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive care for clients.

Responsibilities:

* Conduct comprehensive clinical assessments to evaluate clients' mental health diagnoses, including but not limited to eating disorders, body image issues, and co-occuring mental health conditions.
* Develop personalized treatment plans tailored to meet the unique needs and goals of each client, utilizing evidence-based interventions.
* Provide individual, group, and/or family therapy sessions to clients, utilizing evidence-based therapeutic approaches such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), dialectical behavior therapy (DBT), acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT), and mindfulness-based interventions.
* Work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary treatment team to coordinate care, facilitate referrals, and provide comprehensive eating disorder treatment.
* Regularly monitor clients' progress throughout the course of treatment, adjusting interventions and treatment plans as needed to ensure optimal outcomes.
* Provide crisis intervention and support to clients experiencing acute distress or relapse, collaborating with the treatment team to implement appropriate interventions and ensure client safety.
* Maintain accurate and timely documentation of client assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and other relevant information in compliance with legal and ethical standards.
* Stay abreast of current research, best practices, and emerging trends in the field through ongoing education, training, and participation in professional development activities.

Qualifications:

* A master's degree or higher in clinical psychology, social work, or counseling.
* Current licensure as a therapist (e.g., Licensed Professional Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, Psychologist).
* Specialized training or certification in eating disorder treatment preferred.
* Proficiency in conducting diagnostic assessments, developing treatment plans, and implementing evidence-based therapy modalities. • Strong communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills.
* Empathetic, nonjudgmental, and culturally competent approach to working with diverse clients and their families. • Commitment to maintaining ethical standards, confidentiality, and professional boundaries in all interactions.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work setting:

* Outpatient
* Private practice
* Remote
* Telehealth

License/Certification:

* licensure as a therapist (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Psychologist
description:
**Centurion is proud to be the provider of****mental health services** **to the** **Georgia Department of Corrections*****.***


We are currently seeking a **part****-time** **Psychologist (20 hours per week)** to join our team at **Telfair State Prison** located in **Helena, Georgia.**


The **Psychologist** provides psychological leadership, consultation and direct services for patients in an assigned facility. The Psychologist will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team in providing assessment and treatment of mental and emotional disorders of patients.

* Must have a Georgia license
* Be able to clear a criminal background check, drug test and NPDB
* Must become or currently be CPR certified
* PhD or PsyD Clinical Psychologist

**Schedule:** Two days per week

* Weekdays
* Day Shift
* No nights, holidays or weekends


Centurion Health contracts with state and local governments nationwide to provide comprehensive healthcare services to correctional facilities, state hospitals, and other community settings. Our dedication to making a difference and our passionate team of the best and the brightest healthcare employees has made us one of the leaders of the correctional health industry. Whether you are driven by purpose and impact or on a journey of professional growth, our opportunities can offer both.

**For additional information, please contact Kimberly St. John, Provider Recruiter at (571) 297-3077 or via email at kstjohn@teamcenturion.com.**


 indmhm

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW/LMSW) (Only: CA, OH, FL, ID, MO, MD, NC)
description:
We are seeking Licensed Clinical Social Workers with outpatient experience to provide outpatient care in a remote setting.

* Provide clinical services to clients via telemedicine
* Provide routine outpatient services including psychiatric diagnostic evaluations, individual, family and group therapy and case management.
* Collaborate with our clinical team to ensure quality care is provided to clients

title: Contract Evaluation Psychologist
description:
Contract Psychologist Job Posting

  



Psychological Dimensions (PD), a nationwide police and public safety and risk management consulting firm with physical offices in Atlanta, Denver, and Chicago, invites applications for a licensed psychologist, preferably with previous assessment or forensic training and experience. Our agency provides state-of-the-art forensic risk management psychological evaluations to law enforcement and other safety-sensitive organizations. The psychologist may also have unique opportunities to participate in risk assessment and consultation with television networks and the media.

  



Applications will be accepted from licensed psychologists who have limited assessment experience, preference is given to applicants with experience in risk and threat assessment, psychological pre-employment screening services, critical incident debriefing, and/or police/public safety and corporate fitness for duty evaluations. **Psypact** **APIT** **will be** **required** **before starting**).

  



This contractor opportunity is ideal for psychologists looking for extra income and who are seeking interesting and rewarding work as a consultant with our firm. While prior experience in police and public safety psychology is preferred, we understand that it is difficult to obtain experience in this unique area, and this is not a requirement. Applicants selected will be provided with comprehensive training and supervision from our staff that includes use and interpretation of related testing, as well as interviewing and report writing skills needed to conduct these highly specialized evaluations.

  


**REQUIREMENTS:** Successful applicants must have completed a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology from an APA-accredited program, as well as an APA-accredited pre-doctoral clinical internship. Applicants must be licensed in a PsyPact Member State (https://psypact.org/mpage/psypactmap) AND have or be willing to obtain an active Psypact credential. Efficiency, detail-orientation, and excellent writing skills and grammar are essential requirements. Our schedule is based on the needs of our clients, and while work demand may vary, we do offer flexibility in working with your existing schedule. The contract psychologist should have availability for a minimum commitment of 8 hours/week for evaluations on a set schedule each week.

  


**TO APPLY:** Please submit ***curriculum vitae with*** ***a cover letter*** that addresses your interest.



Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

  



Salary: $100.00 - $425.00 per hour for contract work

  



Work setting: Remote

  



License/Certification:


* Unrestricted license to practice psychology independently in a PsyPact participating State (https://psypact.org/mpage/psypactmap)
* PsyPact-eligible (PsyPact APIT required before starting)


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at Psychological Dimensions (PD): PD is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. PD believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a multi-national company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.

title: Remote Staff Psychologist
description:
Stone, McElroy, & Associates (SMA)/Psychological Dimensions (PD)/COPPS is a growing, innovative, and industry-leading national police and public safety and risk management forensic consulting firm with offices in Atlanta, Chicago, and Denver looking for a Remote Staff Psychologist to join our diverse team. Our mission is to provide state-of-the-art forensic risk management psychological evaluations to law enforcement, public safety, and private organizations. Our firm also conducts risk assessments and consultation with television networks and the media. Services primarily include psychological pre-employment screening, critical incident debriefing, wellness training, annual wellness visits, specialty placement assignments (e.g., SWAT, etc.), risk and threat assessment, and police/public safety and corporate fitness for duty evaluations. For additional information about the firm, see our website at: www.stonemcelroy.com/www.psychologicaldimensions.com/www.coppschicago.com


**About the Role**



The Remote Staff Psychologist will:


* Undergo in-depth training to develop the skills necessary to excel in police and public safety/risk management psychological consulting.
* Conduct remote pre- and post-offer psychological evaluations with public safety agencies/private corporations.
* Conduct remote psychological risk/threat assessments.
* Conduct remote psychological fitness for duty assessments of law enforcement, public safety and civilian personnel.
* Provide remote day-to-day client support concerning hiring and officer safety and wellness.
* Conduct remote critical incident debriefings.


**About You**



The Remote Staff Psychologist will have:


* An independent, unrestricted license to practice psychology in a Psypact state (license-eligible will be considered if currently independently licensed to practice psychology out-of-state).
* PSYPACT Eligibility - Authority to Practice Interjurisdictional Telepsychology (APIT).
* 2+ years of experience in practicing high-quality psychological assessment.
* A strong understanding of psychological test interpretation.
* Superb writing skills and excellent efficiency in report writing.
* Independence and will be self-motivated and directed.
* Superior technological abilities to handle working remotely using Office 365 and video conferencing.


**Our Benefits**



Stone, McElroy, & Associates/Psychological Dimensions/COPPS offers:


* Opportunities to develop a new skill set in police and public safety psychology and state-of-the-art risk/threat assessment.
* Work from the comfort of your home or our new office conveniently located at 285/75.
* A flexible work schedule.
* Malpractice insurance is included at no cost to psychologists.
* Case conferences with our clinical director, staff, consulting psychologists, and managing partners.
* Training and supervision by board-certified police and public safety psychologists.
* Innovative proprietary software to streamline the evaluation and report writing process.
* Support staff to schedule, administer, and score all assessment batteries.
* A collaboration platform to support information sharing and communication with other psychologists.
* Focus on clinical work – we provide support for all billing and administrative duties.
* Paid time off and 13 holidays.
* Paid Health insurance premiums.
* Eligibility in the company’s 401k and Pension programs with competitive matching.
* Paid conference attendance, continuing education, and professional development activities.
* Opportunities to obtain experience and supervision necessary for ABPP certification in Forensic Psychology and Police and Public Safety Psychology.
* Staff development retreats.


The salary range for this position is $90,000 - $105,000

title: School Psychologist - Georgia
description:
**About Marker Learning:**



1 in 5 students has a learning disability such as dyslexia, which makes it harder for them to read, spell and write-despite their intelligence. While receiving a proper evaluation for a learning disability could be the most impactful event in a student's life, only 4% of students receive a diagnosis because of the high costs of evaluations and lack of access to qualified psychologists. Undiagnosed students are 3x more likely to drop out of high school, 5x more likely to be unemployed, and tend to experience elevated levels of anxiety and depression. It's estimated that early diagnosis of dyslexia and other learning disabilities could save the US over 72 billion dollars of economic impact and drastically improve the lives of millions of people.



Marker Learning is on a mission to make learning disability (e.g. dyslexia) assessments and diagnosis easier and more affordable for schools and parents. By leveraging proprietary technology developed by leading experts at Johns Hopkins, the end-to-end evaluation is completed in half the time and at 1/10th the cost of typical in person evaluations. We are a rapidly growing start up, backed by some of the most mission driven and reputable venture capital firms and education non-profits.



Join us in our mission to inspire and support all students on their unique learning paths.

**This position requires the following:**


* Remotely administer academic and cognitive (e.g., WISC-V) assessments for Georgia school districts.
* Synthesize intake forms, behavioral observations, and evaluation results to develop a comprehensive report, including potential diagnoses and actionable recommendations.
* Follow company-wide processes to ensure reports are finished on time to meet your client's expectations.
* Comply with confidentiality laws and Marker Learning policies.


**To qualify for this position, you will need:**


* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
* Professional bedside manner and ability to build rapport with clients in a remote environment
* Comfort with computers and willingness to learn our platforms. This position requires a working knowledge of computers and computer programs (e.g., the ability to conduct a Zoom meeting, etc.)
* Minimum of one year of psychoeducational evaluation testing with children and adults, including full test administration, scoring, and interpretation of standardized academic tests such as the WISC-V, WAIS-IV, WIAT-4, WJ, Conners-3, or KTEA-3.
* At least one year of experience in writing integrated psychological evaluation reports, including test interpretation, clinical formulation, and personalized recommendations.
* Master's degree (or higher) and a license to practice clinical or educational psychology in schools, per the state's requirements.
* Private location with secure WiFi to ensure confidentiality and uncompromised administration of the tests.


**Other benefits of joining the team:**


* **Flexible schedule:** You choose your availability, and the students/parents will book times directly with you on the platform.
* **Training & support:** We will provide you with the training and support you need to be successful. We have 24-hour support for our psychologists.
* **Materials Provided:** We will supply you with the testing materials (e.g., the WISC-V) at no cost.
* **Community & growth:** You'll have the opportunity to connect with other experts in your field and to help shape the future of Marker Learning with your feedback and suggestions!


**Employment Type:** Contractor

**Interested? Great! Here's what you should know:**



At Marker Learning, we know that our people are indispensable to achieving our mission, and we are building an inclusive environment that enables everyone to do their best work. In that spirit, we deliberately hire people from all walks of life — including, but not limited to, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, and disability status. We are a mission-driven team out to provide reliable and affordable testing to every student who requires it, and we believe that Marker Learning has the potential to change the evaluation landscape across the country. We'd love to hear from you if you're motivated by our mission and eager to contribute to our team and culture!



We are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. Marker Learning provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker
description:
**Company Description:**

Therapy Experts is a leading mental health platform dedicated to providing accessible and comprehensive support to individuals seeking therapy services. Our platform offers a range of therapeutic modalities, including video sessions and messaging capabilities, ensuring that clients receive the care they need when they need it. We believe in empowering our counselors to deliver high-quality care while maintaining flexibility and autonomy in their work schedules.

**Job Description:**

Therapy Experts is seeking licensed Mental Health Counselors to join our platform and provide compassionate and effective therapy services to our diverse clientele. As a Mental Health Counselor, you will have the opportunity to work remotely, setting your own flexible schedule to accommodate your personal and professional commitments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Conduct individual therapy sessions via video conferencing and messaging to address clients' mental health concerns.
* Collaborate with clients to develop personalized **treatment plans** and goals tailored to their unique needs and circumstances.
* Maintain accurate and confidential client records, documenting session notes, treatment progress, and any relevant clinical information.
* Actively engage with clients through our platform, providing timely responses to messages and scheduling appointments based on your availability.
* Manage your own schedule using our integrated calendar system, ensuring that you have sufficient time for client sessions, administrative tasks, and personal time.
* Utilize your profile on the Therapy Experts platform to showcase your expertise, credentials, and areas of specialization to attract potential clients.
* Stay informed about current trends and developments in the field of mental health counseling, participating in ongoing training and professional development opportunities as needed.

**Qualifications**:

* Master's or Doctoral degree in Counseling, Psychology, Social Work, or related field from an accredited institution.
* Current licensure as a Mental Health Counselor, Psychologist, Clinical Social Worker, or equivalent in your state or jurisdiction.
* Experience providing therapy services to individuals across diverse populations and presenting concerns.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to establish rapport and build trust with clients in a virtual setting.
* Commitment to upholding ethical standards and maintaining confidentiality in accordance with legal and professional guidelines.

**Benefits:**

* Flexible work schedule, allowing you to set your own hours and manage your caseload according to your availability.
* Access to a user-friendly platform with integrated calendar features for scheduling appointments and managing client communications.
* Competitive compensation package
* Supportive and collaborative work environment, with access to ongoing training, supervision, and professional development resources.
* Ability to take sick leave, vacation time, and personal days as needed, with the flexibility to adjust your schedule accordingly.

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of others and are looking for a rewarding opportunity to practice therapy in a flexible and supportive environment, we encourage you to apply for the position of Mental Health Counselor at Therapy Experts. Join our team and help us empower individuals to live healthier, more fulfilling lives through accessible and effective mental health care.

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter outlining your qualifications.. We look forward to hearing from you!

You can apply via link: https://counselor.calmerry.com/auth/sign-up

title: WA Psychologists Needed to Perform Psych Evaluations - Start Immediately!
description:
**Psychologists Needed to Perform Psych Evaluation Clearances - Start Immediately!**

Across the healthcare landscape, psychologists are becoming integral before and after medical procedures to ensure the holistic care of patients, addressing both mental and physical health needs. Help Therapy seeks innovative psychologists in Washington with telehealth experience who are driven by the vision of treating the entire individual. By joining us, you can significantly reduce instances of preventable patient harm and enhance comprehensive care outcomes.

Our current focus is on psychologists who can perform Psychological Evaluation Clearances for Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS) and Bariatric procedures through telehealth. Each pre-surgical evaluation offers a reimbursement rate ranging from $300 to $500.

**Not credentialed? No problem**! We will facilitate the credentialing process for you. If you are already Medicare credentialed, check out the additional benefits listed below.

**What is Help Therapy?**

Founded in 1993, Help Therapy has consistently worked towards broadening access to top-tier mental health services. We are the bridge that links everyone to therapy while streamlining the business aspects of therapy for professionals. At Help Therapy, we alleviate administrative tasks such as referrals, billing, marketing, credentialing, and compliance, allowing you to function akin to a private practice. We aim to transform your envisioned practice into reality.

**About Spinal Cord Stimulator Evaluations**

SCS represents a novel approach to managing chronic pain and is increasingly emerging as a preferred alternative to medications or back surgery. Yet, the procedure is not devoid of risks. The implanted SCS device connects directly to the patient's nervous system. Research underscores that psychological variables such as anxiety, depression, or inadequate coping mechanisms can adversely impact post-SCS care outcomes. This is where your expertise becomes invaluable in ensuring the patient's safety.

Patients contemplating SCS must first undergo psychological evaluations to ascertain the procedure's appropriateness for them. These evaluations amplify the chances of favorable care outcomes. Conducting a psychological evaluation for SCS entails a clinical interview and a mental status examination, all executed virtually and typically completed within an hour.

**How Help Therapy Works**

Become a part of our team in under a week and instantly start attending to patients for Psychological Evaluation Clearances. Our care team will manage your referrals for patients necessitating SCS pre-surgical psychological evaluations via telehealth. Billing for every psychological evaluation will be seamlessly handled by Help Therapy.

Unfamiliar with Psychological Assessments? Worry not. Our administrative support extends to resources and materials guiding you through the Psych Assessment process.

**Benefits**:

- A continuous flow of patients requiring SCS & Bariatric Psych Evaluations.

- We handle billing, ensuring timely payments without the associated hassles.

- Optimal flexibility - You decide your patient base and consultation timings.

- Assistance with credentialing.

- Transparent finances - Providers are informed beforehand about the reimbursement rate, typically fluctuating between $300-$500 for each SCS evaluation.

**For Those Already Medicare Credentialed:**

- Free video training on conducting SCS Psychological Evaluations.

- Complimentary assessment material kit.

- Expedited onboarding – Begin within 5 business days.

**Requirements**:

- Licensed Psychologist in Washington

- Individual NPI number

- Individual professional malpractice liability insurance policy

**Employment Status**: Please note that psychologists working with Help Therapy operate as independent providers and are not employees of Help Therapy. This agreement is non-exclusive, permitting you to engage with and offer services to other organizations alongside Help Therapy.

To embark on this journey with us, register your details at helptherapy.com/Apply-Today or via Indeed. Our team will initiate contact within 24 hours. We eagerly await our collaboration.

title: Licensed Virtual Therapist
description:
Caring Community Counseling is seeking a Licensed Virtual Therapist to join our team. This position offers the opportunity to provide high-quality mental health services to clients in a virtual setting. The ideal candidate will be licensed and credentialed to work with commercial insurance plans, ensuring accessibility to a wide range of clients seeking therapy services.

Responsibilities:

* Conduct virtual therapy sessions with clients using HIPAA-compliant telehealth platforms, providing evidence-based interventions and personalized treatment plans.
* Conduct comprehensive assessments of clients' mental health needs and develop individualized treatment goals and strategies.
* Collaborate with clients to establish therapeutic rapport, build trust, and facilitate positive therapeutic relationships.
* Provide counseling and psychotherapy services to clients across the lifespan, addressing a variety of mental health concerns, including but not limited to anxiety, depression, trauma, and relationship issues.
* Adhere to ethical guidelines and professional standards in the provision of mental health services, maintaining client confidentiality and privacy at all times.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of client sessions, assessments, treatment plans, and progress notes in compliance with organizational and regulatory requirements.
* Collaborate with other members of the interdisciplinary team, including psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers, and case managers, to ensure coordinated and comprehensive care for clients.
* Participate in regular supervision, case consultations, and professional development activities to enhance clinical skills and knowledge.
* Stay informed about current research, trends, and best practices in the field of mental health therapy, incorporating this knowledge into clinical practice.
* Provide support and education to clients and their families regarding mental health issues, coping skills, and strategies for self-care.

Qualifications:

* Master's or doctoral degree in Counseling, Clinical Psychology, Social Work, or related field from an accredited institution.
* Licensed or license-eligible as a Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), or Psychologist (PsyD) in the state of practice.
* Credentialing with commercial insurance plans is a must.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience providing therapy services to clients in a clinical or virtual setting, with proficiency in telehealth platforms.
* Strong clinical assessment and diagnostic skills, with the ability to formulate comprehensive treatment plans based on client needs.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to establish rapport with clients from diverse backgrounds.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with proficiency in documentation and record-keeping.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a remote team environment.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and continuous learning in the field of mental health therapy.
* Willingness to adhere to a flexible schedule, including some evenings and weekends as needed to accommodate client appointments.

Join our team at Caring Community Counseling and make a positive impact in the lives of individuals and families through virtual therapy services. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits, and a supportive work environment dedicated to the well-being of both clients and staff. Apply today to become part of our dynamic team and contribute to our mission of providing accessible and compassionate mental health care.

title: LMHC - Remote
description:
**Great People Work Here!** **Watch Why at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJuOwUYeb2g**

  

Note: This position is located in Bellevue, WA - 10 miles from Seattle or remote.  

  



  

**About Us: Hope and Future for every child and family**

 *Hope and Future.* These simple words represent the journey we take with our families. Are you looking for a collaborative place where you can see daily that your talents are making progress for the whole-child?

  

ICAN is a multidisciplinary clinic with the vision of a commitment to the best hope and future for children and families affected by autism around the world. We are located in the city of Bellevue Washington and serve individuals with autism and neurodevelopmental disorders from birth to 13 years of age. Our team consists of a Psychologist, Occupational Therapists, Speech Therapists, Board Certified Behavior Analysts, ABA Therapists, Assistive Technology specialists and more. In our years of operation, we have provided services to over 2,200 families all while maintaining no waitlists for services to meet the need of our community. We are an organization that is committed to professionalism, growth and fun.

 **Company Benefits: How we support you in life and career**

  

* Maximum flexibility - make your own schedule
* Multiple Pay Types: Fee-Based or Salaried
* Industry and regionally benchmarked, competitive pay
* Medical, Dental, Vision insurance – Premera PPO or HSA
* 401(K) with potential match
* Paid Time Off (PTO) bank and Paid Holidays
* Monthly Trainings and Annual CEU reimbursement
* Options for positions in variety of settings: clinic; in-home; schools; telehealth

  


**Position: The role you would play** **on our Multi-disciplinary Team**

  

ICAN is a multidisciplinary clinic with the vision of a commitment to the best hope and future for children and families affected by autism around the world. We are located in the city of Bellevue Washington and serve individuals with autism and neurodevelopmental disorders from birth to 13 years of age. Our team consists of a Psychologist, Occupational Therapists, Speech Therapists, Board Certified Behavior Analysts, ABA Therapists, Assistive Technology specialists and more. In our years of operation, we have provided services to over 2,200 families all while maintaining no waitlists for services to meet the need of our community. We are an organization that is committed to professionalism, growth and fun.

* Provide counseling
* Provide crisis intervention and emergency mental health services; may include periodic on-call coverage on nights, weekends, and/or holidays

* Participate in ICAN training and events
* Contribute to passive education campaigns via bulletin boards, social media, and other avenues of communication

  


**Experience Requirements:**  



  

* Licensed or eligible for licensure in Washington State

* Demonstrated ability to manage barrier behaviors
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Experience with word processing and Microsoft Outlook

* Growth - we change to embrace our future
  



ICAN is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. title: EAP Clinician
description:
**\\* Position is not fully remote and requires travel and in-office time. USPS location is in Tallahassee, FL. Must be licensed in and live in Florida. Will consider applicants with LCSW, LMHC, or LMFT license. \\***


Who *We Are*


At Lucet, we are industry leaders in behavioral health, dedicated to helping people live healthy, balanced lives. Our mission - and our passion - *is to improve the lives of the members we serve* and be the ideal partner for our providers.


Lucet's unique combination of people and technology has proven to optimize access to behavioral health care providers and increase a health plan's ability to connect members to quality care. With the industry's largest network of care navigators and technology powered by more than six million assessments and more than 20 years of data, Lucet is the only solution proven to successfully identify and connect people across the entire acuity spectrum with the right care in less than five days on average, and often as little as one day.


Our members, providers and partners fully entrust us to deliver outstanding quality care through coordinated behavioral health services, employee assistance programs, organizational consulting, student well-being programs and more.


When you join Lucet, you become a valued member of our team, serving more than 15 million people across the U.S. Our employees have a passion for helping others - and it shows. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we are inspired by our members, putting them first in everything we do. From day one, you'll see firsthand the impact you have on our members, knowing you can make a true difference in their lives.  



  

Job *Summary*


This position will be dedicated to the USPS EAP Program. The EAP Clinician will provide EAP services including short-term counseling/problem solving, educational and training activities, referral, monitoring, behavioral health consultation, critical incident response and follow-up. The EAP Clinician is responsible for providing services in-person, telephonically or via video.


Essential *Functions*

* Provides counseling and coaching through one-on-one interactions, either in-person or telephonically.
* Provides telephonic consultation, triage and referrals to callers through the virtual call center/Service Center.
* Provides consultation, training of, and assistance to USPS and union leadership.
* Actively promotes the EAP program and services.
* Provides critical incident response and psychological first aid for events that impact the workforce.
* Adheres to Lucet Mission Statement, Core Values, Code of Business Conduct and Compliance Program
* Complies with all Federal and applicable State laws and Lucet policies regarding privacy, confidentiality and security of health information and other designated information


Job *Qualifications*


Required

* A master's and/or doctorate degree from an accredited college or university recognized by the corresponding professional association(s) in a clinical mental health field
* A current state license or state certification to practice as a mental health practitioner (e.g., social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family counselor and professional counselor) in the state(s) where practice takes place. If such licensure/certification is not available in that state, the individual will hold appropriate certification from a recognized national certification organization or board.
* A minimum of 5 Years of clinical experience after receiving a graduate degree.
* Authority to practice at the independent level without requiring state-mandated clinical supervision.
* Demonstrated capability to complete accurate bio-psychosocial assessments, including substance abuse assessments.
* Specialized experience and/or training in phone and video counseling
* Counselors will be knowledgeable about federal and state laws governing privacy, confidentiality, duty to warn and child and elder abuse reporting requirements
* The EAP clinician will be bound by the laws of confidentiality and will discuss no specific clinical information with the referring supervisor unless the client has signed an authorization to use and disclose form authorizing the disclosure of specific information
* This position requires driving. Employee must have an active driver's license and must be insurable. Lucet will request a motor vehicle record from the appropriate authority


Preferred

* Preferred Certified Employee Assistance Professionals (CEAP) and or knowledge and experience in EAP Practice

Key Competencies

* Self-motivated and ability to lead team to achieve Lucet goals
* Ability to engage a wide variety of individuals, and excellent organizational skills
* Passion for improving lives through behavioral change and wellness
* Proven interest in professional development through specialization, certification, and/or advance degree
* Maintains curiosity and an eagerness to explore new knowledge and try new ideas and approached to case management

This position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of Lucet's incentive plan based on both company performance and individual performance.

title: Psychologist
description:
**Job Description**

Are you interested in developing your knowledge of psychological assessments in the area of clinical and forensic psychology? Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. is a leading California business providing numerous clinical and forensic evaluations. Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. is home to the Mental Competency Assessment and Training (MCAT) Community-Based Program, Juvenile and Adult Training for Competency to Stand Trial, a fundamental program providing comprehensive mental competency services, including assessments and training, for juveniles and adults.

We are seeking a part-time committed professional to fulfill the Psychologist position to complete forensic assessments for juveniles and adults. Assessments are completed remotely with the option to complete some assessments within the community. This is a great opportunity to merge your passion for psychology into a more varied and dynamic career. You will join an equally enthusiastic and experienced clinical and forensic team who shares your desire to utilize assessments in the field of psychology. We provide comprehensive training, support, and guidance in assisting you with your professional development. If you want to be a part of an innovative organization with rewarding new challenges as a compassionate and professional clinical and forensic Psychologist, apply today and don’t let this career opportunity pass you by!

**Job Responsibilities**

As a **Psychologist** you should be committed, compassionate, and detail oriented. You will be working with a variety of clients completing mental competency assessments for juveniles and adults.

· Complete comprehensive mental competency evaluations including test administration and report writing with interpretations, recommendations, and diagnoses

· Serve juveniles and adults

· Advancement opportunities are possible, if desired, with increased duties including additional clinical and forensic assessments and providing professional presentations and courses.

· Develop rapport with clients and maintain a respectful environment

· Maintain case management duties including report writing

· Communicate consistently with other applicable team members regarding job responsibilities

· Complete assessments electronically from home with the additional option of completing some assessments within correctional facilities and community locations.

· Use of computer applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

**Job Requirements**

As a Psychologist, you must be enthusiastic and efficient with the ability to adjust to various assessment requirements. Excellent organizational skills and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, are essential.

Additional requirements of our Psychologist include:

· California state professional licensed psychologist

· Quickly adapt to change and demonstrate flexibility to adjust to company needs

· Effectively demonstrate organizational skills, an efficient work style, attention to detail, time management skills and prioritization of tasks

· Ability to serve as an effective and positive force within the company

· Maintain communication and a consistent cooperative attitude in working with applicable program team members

· Willingness to travel -10% (Optional)

· Valid California driver's license (optional)

**Benefits**

As a Psychologist with Psychwest, Clinical & Forensic Psychology, Inc. you will enjoy a professional, yet relaxed working environment, as well as receive superior internal training opportunities along with support and knowledge from our experienced forensic team. Our primary office is located in Yuba City with additional branches throughout California.

**Qualified Employees receive:**

* Mileage Reimbursement
* Use of work laptop
* Use of all testing materials and forms

\\*

If interested, please send:  
1) Resume  
2) Completed application (found at www.psychwest.com/Jobs/)

title: Behavioral Health Psychologist Reviewer
description:
Who We Are
Point32Health is a leading health and wellbeing organization, delivering an ever-better personalized health care experience to everyone in our communities. At Point32Health, we are building on the quality, nonprofit heritage of our founding organizations, Tufts Health Plan and Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, where we leverage our experience and expertise to help people find their version of healthier living through a broad range of health plans and tools that make navigating health and wellbeing easier.
We enjoy the important work we do every day in service to our members, partners, colleagues and communities. To learn more about who we are at Point32Health, click here.
Job Summary
The Behavioral Health Psychologist Reviewer will primarily perform utilization management and provider payment reviews for all Point32Health products, as well as any partner entities at the direction of Behavioral Health Medical Director Team Leader for Utilization Management (UM) and/or the Medical Director of UM. These functions will include prospective, concurrent, and retrospective utilization reviews including both member facing initial reviews and appeals. They will work closely with colleagues in UM and Medical Management, and with other departments as needed, including but not limited to Claims Operations, Actuarial, and Quality Management. They will assist with performing clinical reviews of provider claims payment disputes, perform retrospective claims audits of medical records, and review potential quality of care issues and credentialing related to their specialties.  

  

Essential functions may occur simultaneously; therefore, the Behavioral Health Psychologist Reviewer must be able to appropriately handle each essential function, prioritize them and seek assistance when necessary. The expectation is for these functions to be performed on a consistent and regular basis, using good judgment. Ability to learn and apply company policies consistently and to seek guidance, when necessary, will be of utmost importance.
Key Responsibilities/Duties – what you will be doing
Utilization Management* Performs clinical review of prospective, concurrent, and retrospective coverage requests for Neuropsychological and Psychological Testing services requiring prior authorization and medical necessity review for all lines of business.
* Communicates with providers, provider groups, facilities, and others as necessary to obtain information and any resolve clinical issues and concerns.
* Supports the provider inquiry line for peer-to-peer discussions.
* Performs clinical review of expedited and standard appeals for all lines of business.
* Provides psychologist expertise and input for provider payment disputes.
* Participates in biannual inter-rater reliability exercises.


Qualifications – what you need to perform the job
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE: (Minimum educational qualifications)* Candidate will be a Ph.D. or Psy.D. psychologist.
* Minimum of five years of clinical experience is required.
* Significant utilization management, quality and / or management experience, either at another health plan or at a local provider unit, medical group, or health care facility is preferred.
* They are required to have a current unrestricted license as a psychologist in Massachusetts


SKILL REQUIREMENTS:* Performs utilization management activities in accordance with accreditation standards and regulatory guidelines described in legacy Tufts Health Plan or Harvard Pilgrim Health Care UM Policy and Procedure Manual.
* Render medical necessity coverage determinations in accordance with legacy Tufts Health Plan or Harvard Pilgrim Health Care Medical Necessity Guidelines and the member’s EOC / benefit document.
* Render/provide appeal decisions following legacy Tufts Health Plan or Harvard Pilgrim Health Care claims payment policies.
* Have an understanding of principles of utilization management and quality assurance.
* Have the skills to communicate with and educate Point32Health peers as well as Tufts Health Plan or Harvard Pilgrim Health Care participating physicians and psychologists and other providers in a collegial manner.
* Be an effective team player, with excellent interpersonal and cross-departmental collaboration skills.


WORKING CONDITIONS AND ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS (include special requirements, e.g., lifting, travel,
overtime)
Point32Health is a fast-paced professional environment requiring a high level of initiative and robust decision-making skills. Effective use of a company issued personal computer is important. The Behavioral Health Psychologist Reviewer will be given appropriate training in all the Healthcare services applications used at legacy Tufts Health Plan or Harvard Pilgrim Health Care.
We encourage a hybrid model for the first 90 days of employment with 1 to 3 days on-site per week. Remote work may be an option after first 90 days of employment and after approval of the same from the Supervisor.
CONFIDENTIAL DATA: All information (written, verbal, electronic, etc.) that an employee encounters while working at Point32Health is considered confidential. The employee will be exposed to and required to deal with highly confidential and sensitive material and must always adhere to corporate compliance policy and department guidelines/policies and all applicable laws and regulations.
Compensation & Total Rewards Overview
As part of our comprehensive total rewards program, colleagues are also eligible for variable pay. Eligibility for any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits remains in the Company's sole discretion and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.
Point32Health offers their Colleagues a competitive and comprehensive total rewards package which currently includes:* Medical, dental and vision coverage
* Retirement plans
* Paid time off
* Employer-paid life and disability insurance with additional buy-up coverage options
* Tuition program
* Well-being benefits
* Full suite of benefits to support career development, individual & family health, and financial health


For more details on our total rewards programs, visit https://www.point32health.org/careers/benefits/
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Accessibility (DEIA) and Health Equity
Point32Health is committed to making diversity, equity, inclusion, accessibility and health equity part of everything we do—from product design to the workforce driving that innovation. Our Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Accessibility (DEIA) and Health Equity team's strategy is deeply connected to our core values and will evolve as the changing nature of work shifts. Programming, events, and an inclusion infrastructure play a role in how we spread cultural awareness, train people leaders on engaging with their teams and provide parameters on how to recruit and retain talented and dynamic talent. We welcome all applicants and qualified individuals, who will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Telehealth Virtual Clinical Psychologist or Psychotherapist
description:
***Clinical Psychologist or Psychotherapist or Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner***

**About the position**

We have a full-time (or 2 part-time) staff positions available for a licensed mental health clinician / psychotherapist to work in one or more of hour outpatient clinics in New Jersey or remotely from their home office performing intakes, psychiatric diagnostic exams and outpatient psychotherapy services. Part-time options (minimum 16 hours per week) are also available. Clinicians who work with all age groups are preferred but pediatric or adult specialists are also needed. As described below, we have 5 clinical centers at NCBI serving patients across the life-span. The successful candidates will evaluate and treat patients and their families across one or more of these centers based on their area of expertise.

Primary duties include administering:

* Biopsychosocial histories
* Structured psychiatric exams
* Training in specialized psychological diagnostic measures is also offered across a variety of disorders such as Autism, Schizophrenic and bipolar spectrum disorder, personality disorders, OCD, PTSD as well as specialized diagnostic interviews for parents/children presenting with mood disorder.
* Individual and/or group psychotherapy with children, adolescents or adults based on each clinicians experience with various age groups
* Behavioral training for caregivers and patients
* Social skills therapy
* Psychopharmacological consultation for prescribing clinicians

You will be part of a clinical team providing the above outlined mental health services. Upon completion of a patient's neurodiagnostic evaluation, many of our patients require psychotherapy, behavioral therapy, behavioral therapy training for parents/caregivers and other mental health related treatments. The active phase of their treatments is typically 8-12 weeks. Generally patients are treated 2 x weekly during the first half of their treatment. Some patients do require maintenance treatments. Common disorders treated at NCBI include: ADHD, Autism, neuropsychiatric syndromes secondary to acquired and traumatic brain injuries mood disorders, somatoform disorders, OCD and Tourette's syndrome, as well as psychotic and personality disorders.

You will also participate in diagnostic intake and exam as well as psychotherapy rounds with other mental health clinicians at NCBI. You will participate as a rater in one or more of our clinical research trials.

**Qualifications**

You must be NJ licensed or licensed in another state with the capability of becoming licensed in NJ within the next 3-4 months of your hire and have or be eligible for CMS credentialing. Applicants can apply if they have an LPC, LCSW, APN, Ph.D. or Psy.D. in clinical psychology, or APN in psychiatry with training in psychotherapy. Candidates should have at least 3 years of clinical experience as a licensed mental health clinician providing psychiatric diagnostic and psychotherapy services.

Salary and Benefits

Competitive base salary with quarterly cash bonuses and other incentives and benefits as described within for full-time employees with some benefits also available for part-time employees. Salary is based on education/degree, years of clinical experience and interpersonal skills. A signing bonus is also being offered which is paid out at the end of the employees 3-month probationary / acclimation period.

**About the NeuroCognitive & Behavioral Institute (NCBI)**  
The NeuroCognitive & Behavioral Institute specializes in diagnosing and treating cognitive, neuropsychiatric and neurobehavioral disorders in pediatrics, adolescents, adults and geriatrics. We have 5 clinical programs/centers that are represented in each of our 4 outpatient clinics in New Jersey and we operate in 10 other states across the US:

1) The Neurodevelopmental Diagnostics and Treatment Center; 2) The Center for Acquired and Traumatic Brain Injury; 3) The Mind-Body Neuropsychiatric and Mental Health Disorders Center: 4) The Center for the Prevention and Treatment of Neurodegenerative diseases and; 5) The Sleep Study and Treatment Center. NCBI clinics are located in Morris, Somerset and Essex County NJ. We also have a very active clinical research division where we conduct early-late drug development, functional brain mapping and neuromodulation research.

visit www.neuroci.com for additional information about NCBI

title: Remote PSYPACT Clinical Psychologist
description:
**About Us:**  
Total Life is on a mission to support seniors and combat mental health issues by making quality, affordable emotional support services easily accessible. We are a behavioral health company solely committed to serving seniors by taking an evidence-based approach to mental health and aging. Total Life is empowering seniors to live more fulfilling lives because we know age is just a number.

**The Opportunity**:  
Total Life is currently seeking a **Licensed PSYPACT Clinical Psychologist** to provide virtual individual and/or group therapy. Therapists must have proven experience working with clients suffering from anxiety, depression, grief and loss, loneliness, life transition, medication/pain management, and end-of-life planning. This is an exciting opportunity for therapists who want to be part of a thriving start-up with the opportunity for growth and extra income. This is a fully remote position.

**Your Role**:

* Provide virtual individual therapy
* Utilize psychotherapy and evidence-based approaches to improve outcomes
* Change the lives of seniors

**Our Requirements:**

* Must have a valid Clinical Psychologist (Psy.D / Ph.D) license in the United States
* Must have a valid Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact (PSYPACT) License
* At least two years of clinical experience, post-licensure conducting psychotherapy utilizing CBT, DBT and other solution-focused approaches
* Must possess and provide proof of professional liability insurance/malpractice insurance or will need to purchase a policy prior to hiring. Maintain current liability insurance of at least $1,000,000 claim limit/$3,000,000 aggregate
* Must have experience working with clients who are age 65+
* Must have an active NPI
* Must be available to start with a minimum of **5 hours per week**
* Must be comfortable utilizing technology and providing teletherapy
* Existing credentialing with Medicare is a plus
* CAQH credentialing already set up is a plus
* Must be able to pass a criminal background check

**Compensation**:

* $80-$100 per session based on experience and credentials.

**Perks**:

* Opportunities for growth
* Flexible schedule

**Schedule**:

* Part-time or full-time hours available
* Options for Monday-Friday and weekend availability

**Even if you do not meet all of our criteria or have any questions please do not hesitate to apply. We would love to meet you!**

**Please attach your resume outlining your professional experience.**

title: Director Of Operations - Mental Health
company: Find Your Balance, Center for Growth & Change Inc
description:
Must be a resident of California and be licensed in California.


Our ideal candidate has previous experience working in a mental health setting managing operations and providing clinical supervision to clinicians.


Our ideal candidate is a licensed psychologist or licensed therapist and able to provide supervision to clinicians.


The position includes managing the day-to-day operations of the organization, ensuring compliance with all applicable regulations and policies, and ensuring that services are delivered in an effective and efficient manner.


We are searching for an experienced person to organize and manage our mental health practice's day-to-day operations and work with our Clinical team to oversee clinical services. You will manage the company's procedures and guide its employees to ensure it is well-coordinated and productive. You will collaborate with the office manager, clinical supervisors, director, and other department heads to ensure that operations are running smoothly, and all goals are met.

**Compensation:**
$115,000 - $120,000 yearly

**Responsibilities:*** Operations management: Provide leadership and direction to the operational and administrative functions of the organization and work hand in hand with the office manager and admin staff. Hire, train, and supervise staff members as needed to support the organization's operations. Oversee and manage the workflow of the office
* Policy & Procedures: Develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure compliance with all applicable regulations and policies
* Systems & Development: Develop and implement systems and processes to improve organizational efficiency and effectiveness. Develop and implement performance metrics and measurement systems to track progress toward organizational goals
* Supervising clinical staff: Oversees clinicians, providing support and guidance when needed, ensuring compliance with policies and procedures, and conducting performance evaluations
* Managing the budget: Manages the budget for the group practice, ensuring that resources are allocated appropriately and that the practice is financially sustainable
* Ensuring compliance: Ensures that all group practice services are in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, and standards
* Providing training and education: Provides training and education to clinical staff, ensuring that they are up-to-date on the latest research and best practices in their field
* Collaborating with other departments: Collaborates with other departments and people within the organization, such as the Director, Office Manager, Supervisors, and Billing department to ensure that clinical services are aligned with the overall mission and goals of the organization
* Managing relationships: Manages and develops relationships with clinics, agencies, community organizations, and other healthcare providers, to ensure that clinical services are effective and meet the needs of the community

**Qualifications:*** Master's degree or doctorate degree, fully licensed with a license in good standing
* At least 2-5 years of experience in operations management, preferably in the mental health field
* Insurance knowledge
* Strong leadership and management skills, with the ability to motivate and develop staff members
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively
* Strong financial management skills, with experience in budgeting, fiscal reporting, and financial analysis
* Knowledge of regulatory and policy requirements related to mental health services
* Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
* Commitment to the mission and values of the organization

**About Company**  

We are a small but fast-growing telehealth mental health practice in CA. As we continue to grow, we continue to add valuable members to our team to help with our growth. We help people every single day to overcome their mental health struggles. Join us in changing the world one person at a time.

title: Fee for Service Therapist
description:
**Fee-for-Service Clinician at Perennial Wellness PLLC**

Perennial Wellness PLLC (PW) invites applications for a 24-month, full time (24+ patient hours/week) licensed psychologist or LCSW to work with patients exclusively via telehealth. LMSWs who are an excellent fit are encouraged to apply, as well.

*The candidate must either be licensed in NY or CT, or open to obtaining licensure in both states.*

**Practice Overview:**

PW is a thriving, full-fee group practice based in Westport, CT, serving patients via telehealth across New York and Connecticut. Website: www.perennialwellnessllc.com.

At PW, we are a collaborative team of psychologists and social workers, and we believe that women deserve a holistic, evidence-based approach to mental health care. We understand the unique experience of womanhood. From navigating early adulthood, to the perinatal and postpartum period, to motherhood, perimenopause and beyond, we integrate evidence-based approaches to mental health care with a deep understanding of interpersonal neurobiology, child development, and attachment philosophies.

Our team values close collaboration with one another, in the form of supervision, case consultation, didactic trainings, and team building experiences. We offer our patients:

1. Individual Therapy: Our approach combines a holistic approach to treatment with a feminist application of cognitive behavioral therapy. Treatment subspecialties include: Peripartum Mood and Anxiety Disorders (PMADs); Anxiety; OCD; Perfectionism; Relationship Concerns; Grief and Loss; Career Counseling; and Parenting a Child with Special Needs.

2. Parenting Support: Our work with parents is grounded in interpersonal neurobiology, respectful parenting principles and the DIR Floortime model.

3. Executive Functioning Skills Coaching: We integrate a nuanced awareness of a woman’s neurobiology with actionable, skill-building interventions to help each woman strengthen her productivity, organization, time management skills, and more.

All individual therapy patients are served via telehealth and while the position is fully remote, there are opportunities for in-person group work, workshops, etc. to be facilitated at the applicant’s discretion, if the applicant is local to Westport, CT.

At PW, teletherapy allows women who are seeking specialized, evidence-based treatment to receive high-quality, individualized care, regardless of their physical location. Teletherapy allows for accessibility and convenience when it’s hard for women to get into the office, which is often the case for women in the peripartum period.

**Clinician’s Responsibilities:**

* Conduct psychiatric intakes with diagnosis, treatment planning and coordination of care with outside providers.
* Conduct individual psychotherapy for a caseload of 24+ patients through an integrative, evidence-based approach.
* Conduct dyadic parent sessions as needed focused on providing supportive interventions to navigate complex parenting-related challenges and dynamics.
* Attend and participate in weekly individual supervision with Dr. Levine, as well as twice monthly group supervision with the full PW team.
* Opportunities to develop a smaller caseload focused on Executive Functioning Skills Coaching for women with ADHD, under additional specialized supervision from clinical neuropsychologist Dr. Danielle Auslander, PsyD.

The candidate will have input into the specific days/times that she holds “office hours,” as this is a benefit of telehealth as a treatment modality. The candidate must be willing to see patients during evening hours one day per week (4p – 8p).

This position is ideal for an applicant (1) with a strong interest in women’s mental health and (2) who is seeking to learn more about how to cultivate a thriving telehealth practice within a private practice setting. The candidate will receive training and support in all clinical aspects of her work, as well as in the business-related aspects of maintaining an ethical, legal, and successful telehealth private practice.

**PW is seeking to hire an applicant who is:** 

1. Passionate about women’s mental health.

2. Eager for mentorship and training in modern private practice development.

3. Motivated to develop competencies in building and sustaining an effective, legal and ethical telehealth practice.

4. Highly autonomous and organized.

5. Honest, collaborative, and eager to grow as a part of a team.

Emma Levine, PhD is the Director of PW. She is a psychologist and clinical supervisor. She was formerly the Assistant Director at Cognitive Therapy for Women in New York City, where she helped to develop and implement their Postdoctoral Fellowship supervision training program. She completed her APA-accredited pre-doctoral internship training at Andrus Children’s Center in Yonkers, NY.

Dr. Levine has served as an Adjunct Professor in the Graduate School of Education at Fordham University. She has advanced training in the assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of Perinatal Mood and Anxiety Disorders (PMADs) from the Selini Institute in New York City. She regularly presents to parents and school communities on topics related to maternal mental health and parenting.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Competitive W2, fee-for-service position.
* Opportunities to remain and grow as a part of the PW team available upon successful completion of contract.
* Weekly, individual supervision is provided.
* Twice monthly team case consultation and didactics.
* A 401K plan immediately upon hire.
* Stipends for trainings and conferences.
* This position does not include health or malpractice insurance.

PW is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. We value hiring candidates who emulate diversity of life experiences, perspective and thought. We care deeply about cultivating a community among our team that feels safe and inclusive, and that encourages important dialogues about issues of diversity among our team and our patients.

**Applicant Instructions:**  Please send a cover letter indicating your interest in this position, a C.V., and two letters of recommendation to Dr. Emma Levine by email at drlevine@perennialwellnessllc.com. Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, and an offer will be made when the right applicant is found. No phone calls please.

title: Licensed Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Service description**

**SUMMARY**

**In collaboration with the neuroTree (NT) clinical team, the Pain Psychologist's role is to administer pain evaluations, score, interpret assessments, write reports, and provide ongoing psychotherapy or as the treatment plan calls for. The** **primary population will be focused on patients experiencing chronic pain, TMD, neuropathic pain, orofacial pain, trauma-related challenges, and intellectual developmental disability community.** 

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Clinical interview
* Psychological testing, pain assessments, and integrative reports
* Trained in trauma-informed treatment modalities.
* Must accept the assignment within 24 hours of being offered the position
* Work flexible hours, and maintain agility
* Give clear, concise, and constructive feedback where appropriate.
* Guide through the cases, rules, guidelines, ethical policies, billing, and payments, etc.
* Be communicative with billing department by submitting claims on timely manner, and keeping the referring doctor up to date with progress reports.
* Psychometric testing (including but not limited to the CPCI, MHP, and SOPA, etc.) and integrative reports - diagnostic assessments, long-term disability assessments for civilians and veterans, serious/catastrophic Impairment assessments, and workplace injury assessments.
* Provide individual psychotherapy at a sliding scale when appropriate.
* Collaborate with staff and the Executive Team to support neuroTree’s expectations for job performance, productivity, quality, goal accomplishment, and mission implementation.
* Meet regularly with the Development Team if appropriate
* Work effectively with all diverse c within neuroTree and externally, including board members, staff, and volunteers
* Represent the agency in a professional manner at meetings and community events

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

* Ability to have access to a computer reliable internet, and phone.
* Required to be available to the clients via telehealth.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

* Have a current license to practice Clinical and Pain Psychology in the state of California.
* Have appropriate training in Pain Psychological testing and integrative reports.
* Doctorate from an accredited or state-approved program with a minimum of 5 years of job-related experience.
* Familiar with the biopsychosocial model; including whole person assessment tools.
* Ability to coordinate, plan, manage, and oversee many aspects of a company for optimum productivity.
* Ability to work with multi-ethnic populations and populations with mental illness.
* Ability to work in a flexible work environment;
* Well organized, self-directed, and with good interpersonal skills.
* Access to transportation.
* Access to SimplePractice, but not limited to this software programs for testing.
* Must be on the panel for Medicare
* Must be registered in PsyPact network.

title: REMOTE Licensed Clinical Psychologist
company: Meridian Counseling: Individual and Family Therapy, Inc.
description:
Meridian Counseling is looking for a licensed mental health therapist to join our growing team! We are a clinician-founded, hybrid practice offering both telehealth and in-person therapy in California and Utah. We are rapidly growing and are dedicated to helping our clients integrate mental health into their everyday health and wellness routine.
  
  

**Our Mission:** Bring mental wellness to the masses!
  
  

**Our Values:** Quality care, community, and accessibility.
  
  

**Check Us Out:** https://meridian-counseling.com/
  
  

About The Role
  
  

* We value our clinicians and their own professional goals. Working for us gives you the flexibility to create the "perfect position" based on your personal and career goals.
* We guarantee that we will provide you with both private pay and insurance-based client referrals (as many as you would like based on your financial goals).
* Licensed therapists with 2-years of clinical experience can opt to provide supervision to our unlicensed therapists.
* Psychologists have opportunities to do clinical assessments with our clients.
* Clinicians have the opportunity for bonus pay, through our incentive program.
* Our clinicians set their own hours/caseload and have the option for hourly or salaried positions and benefits.
* Clinicians also can opt for in-person sessions at our beautiful offices, or work from the comfort of their own homes. (Whatever works best for you)!
* Meridian offers the opportunity to participate in monthly consultations with our clinical team. (Our clinicians are awesome and always willing to support each other in professional growth).
* Meridian has strong values in building community and genuine connection - we want to assure our values are always intertwined within our team culture! We are excited to offer our monthly team events (training, workshops, volleyball, hikes, game nights, etc)!
* We will handle your billing, credentialing, and marketing and provide you with clients and office space. Your job is to show up, see your clients, and take notes!
* This is the perfect position for someone who wants the autonomy of private practice, while still feeling connected to a community and receiving consultation, as needed.
* If you love doing clinical work and do not want to deal with all the administrative and business headaches that come with running a practice - this is the position for you!


Minimum Qualifications
  
  

* Doctorate's degree in Psychology, or similar.
* Must be licensed as a Psychologist or PsyD.
* Must be able to obtain credentialing to work with insurance panels.


Preferred Qualifications
  
  

* Experience with trauma, mood disorders, addiction, families, and couples
* Comfortable with electronic medical records.
* CBT, DBT, ACT or EMDR Training preferred


Compensation
  
  

* Additional compensation is available for writing blog posts, hosting workshops, etc.


**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time, Flextime
  
  

**Pay:** $80,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year + bonuses
