title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
### **Why You'll Love This Job**



(Salary ranges from $95,000-$140,000 per year)


Take your psychology career to the next level as you work remotely from the comfort of your own home office, helping underserved patients in rural areas receive the healthcare assistance they deserve via tele-video, in MediTelecare's Clinical Psychologist remote telehealth position. We provide in-person, telehealth and also hybrid services, so there are multiple options within our company.  

  

Working remotely as a Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth provider with MediTelecare, you have the unique opportunity to breathe new life into your career, serving as a lifeline to grateful patients who otherwise would go without the mental health treatment they need to lead their best lives. This role will allow you to hone your skills as an expert consultant in behavioral health and, with no administrative or billing duties to tie you down, you are free to fully focus on your patients. Your efforts will be far-reaching, also bringing much-needed and appreciated assistance to under-resourced facility care teams who will welcome your experience and guidance. You personally will benefit from having an established caseload, a generous compensation package with strong earning potential based on productivity, an enviable comprehensive benefits package and a stellar support staff invested in you and your team's success.  

  

Join a dynamic, autonomous environment where your ideas and valued input will help shape the way we work as well as positively impact the future of the telehealth industry! Apply for MediTelecare's Clinical Psychologist - remote Telehealth job opening today.
### **Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth Responsibilities**


* Conduct psychotherapy and behavioral management sessions remotely using tele-video technology
* Perform neurocognitive testing using tele-video technology; provide virtual in-service education
* Collaborate with facility staff; consult with interdisciplinary team members
* Complete patient notes in our Electronic Health Records (EHR) system

  

  

### **Clinical Psychologist - Telehealth Qualifications**


* Ph.D., PsyD, or equivalent doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology from an accredited university
* Significant experience in treating adult and/or elderly patient population
* Ability to work on a company provided secure computer using Internet-based electronic applications
* Must have a quiet private location at home or office space in which to consult with patients via tele-video
* Experience working with patients with severe persistent mental illness preferred

title: Licensed Psychologist (Fully Remote)
description:
We are seeking highly motivated and qualified **Licensed** **Psychologists** for a **full-time** or **part-time** position. This position is fully remote and applicants must reside in Washington State.

This role primarily involves providing **individual therapy through Telehealth**. There is also the option to perform psychological evaluations for disability if so desired. At The Joy and Wellness Center, each provider works with the ages and clinical presentations that fit with their own preferences. Providers and clients work best with each other when there is goodness of fit.

The Joy and Wellness Center is a group behavioral health practice in Puyallup, WA. Our mission is to provide innovative, holistic mental health services to children, adolescents, adults, couples and families in the most caring environment possible. We believe it’s important not just to treat mental illness, but to promote mental wellness. Our team of friendly, professional providers offer therapeutic interventions that are based on empirical research combined with years of clinical training and experience, in order to help improve the emotional health and wellbeing of our community.

**Responsibilities for this position include:**

* Conducting thorough biopsychosocial history interviews.
* Formulating clinically appropriate DSM-5 diagnoses.
* Developing appropriate and collaborate treatment plans with therapy clients.
* Providing evidence-based treatment to therapy clients.
* Writing timely intake reports, progress notes, etc., using Electronic Health Records.
* Utilize outcome measures to track client progress.
* Participating in regular team meetings with other remote providers and/or staff.

**Requirements:**

* Doctorate Degree
* Washington State Psychology License
* Must Reside in Washington State
* Training and experience implementing evidenced based practices
* Ability to write quality notes/reports
* Good time management skills

**Benefits Include:**

* Flexible scheduling based on your time preferences
* No on-call responsibilities
* Laptop and Telehealth equipment provided
* Reception and Billing services included
* Four weeks of unpaid vacation
* Consultation and collaboration with peers

Preference will go to individuals who are personable and friendly, professional, and reliable. Applicants should also possess a wide range of clinical skills and an interest in working with a growing and innovative group practice.

To apply, please email a cover letter, a CV or resume, and a list of three professional references with contact information. Applicants must have earned a PhD or PsyD and be licensed in the state of Washington.

title: Clinical Care Operations Manager
description:
**Join Cartwheel to help tackle the student mental health crisis.**



Kids spend most of their days in the classroom. And teachers and staff, who play a vital role in their development, are often the first to notice when something is off. But with 1 in 5 young people struggling with mental health, schools are getting crushed by a downward spiral in student crises and staff burnout.



With large increases in federal funding for schools and the rise of telehealth, schools are reimagining what mental health support can look like.



Cartwheel is an early-stage startup building technology-enabled mental health services that put schools at the center. We see our role as supporting on-campus counselors, psychologists, and school social workers who see kids every day. Instead of going around them, we collaborate with them. This means:


* Earlier intervention
* Higher student and family engagement in care
* Better coordination among the trusted adults in a student's life


Kids shouldn't just aspire to get out of bed and drag themselves to class. They should be able to experience joy. They deserve to envision and build a life they're excited to live. If you join Cartwheel, you'll help make this vision a reality for millions of students across the country. We're backed by top investors including General Catalyst, BoxGroup, and Able Partners, and we're looking for scrappy, mission-driven teammates to join our team.


**ABOUT THE ROLE**



As a **Clinical Care Operations Manager**, you will be responsible for enhancing operational efficiency of the patient care journey. You will work closely with our Care Operations, Clinical, and Product teams to lead process improvement projects and ensure smooth change management. Your attention to process, excellent problem solving skills, and commitment to patient experience will contribute to the success of Cartwheel as we become the trusted mental health partner for schools nationwide.


**WHO YOU ARE**


* 3+ years of experience in clinical operations, process improvement, or similar roles.
* Clinical background OR in-depth experience in behavioral health operations
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools.
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proven track record of facilitating cross-functional knowledge management and training initiatives.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Highly independent, proactive, resilient, and empathetic.


The above is a summary of the role, not an exhaustive list. If you think that you have most of the above but not everything, please apply. We'd love to hear from you.


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**



Clinical Care Process Improvement


* Conduct thorough analysis of current processes, identify pain points, bottlenecks, and areas for improvement.
* Facilitate workshops, brainstorming sessions, and process mapping exercises to find opportunities for process improvement.
* Collaborate across functions to smoothly implement process improvements.


Project Management


* Lead cross-functional project teams to implement process improvement initiatives.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define project scope, objectives, and success criteria.
* Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure on-time delivery.


Knowledge Management


* Create and maintain documentation for processes, procedures, and best practices.
* Regularly review and update knowledge resources for relevance and accuracy.
* Support during transitions and changes by providing relevant information and resources to employees.


**REPORTS TO:** Head of Clinical Care


#### **WHY YOU'LL LOVE CARTWHEEL**



Our hope is that Cartwheel will be your best career decision! In addition to tackling one of the biggest challenges of our time, at a company well-positioned to do so, you'll have:


* Team-based culture with mission-driven colleagues who will go to bat for you
* Total cash compensation between $95,000 and $110,000
* Excellent health insurance
* Meaningful equity ownership stake
* Flexible paid time off
* Remote work environment with regular in-person team retreats
* 401K with employer match
* $500 annual educational stipend
* Macbook


*Cartwheel is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diverse backgrounds and perspectives and an inclusive work environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Clinical Neuropsychologist (100% REMOTE WORK)
description:
Minder Memory Center opened in January 2023 and provides neuropsychological evaluations and treatment through our online portal across 40 states. We are in the process of becoming contracted with the four largest health insurance companies and are looking to grow our team. We are looking to hire a clinical neuropsychologists who have experience assessing children and adults for developmental conditions (e.g., Autism, learning disorder) and acquired conditions (e.g., dementia, TBI). All job duties will be performed remotely. We are offering yearly pay that ranges from $120,000-$170,000, depending on hours worked and level of efficiency. We will only consider applicants that are able to work 30+ hours per week. To qualify for this position, you must be Psypact certified and living in a Psypact state. You must also be *eligible* for board certification in clinical neuropsychology (i.e., have sufficient pre-doctoral, internship, and postdoctoral training). This position would likely start in late April, but could start sooner. See below for more details.

**Responsibilities**

-Neuropsychological evaluations [~85% of time]

-Administrative duties [~15% of time]

**Required Qualifications**

-Must be a licensed clinical psychologist in one of the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact (PSYPACT) states (https://psypact.site-ym.com/page/psypactmap)

-You must be authorized to practice psychology telehealth under Psypact.

-Must have received predoctoral and postdoctoral training in clinical neuropsychology.

-Must be *eligible* for board certification in clinical neuropsychology.

-Must have at least two years of experience working in developmental neuropsychology under your own license.

-Must be willing to complete a background check.

**Required Documents**

-PSYPACT documentation

- 2 recent sample neuropsychological reports (de-identified)

-CV

title: Clinical Neuropsychologist
description:
**Position Title: Neuropsychologist (PsyD)**

**Company description:**

Based on over forty combined years in healthcare, Silver Lining’s founders created Silver Lining Behavioral Health with a vision to blend mental health and healthcare. Our clinical team is skilled in providing psychotherapy services, and our clinicians can liaise between patients’ healthcare providers, families, and other multidisciplinary healthcare professionals as needed. As a team, Silver Lining Behavioral Health staff also serves as a resource for community services and healthcare navigation.

We take care of you so you can take care of your clients. Partnering with Silver Lining empowers you to determine your work-life balance. Let Silver Lining Behavioral Health take on administrative and daunting tasks such as marketing, insurance pre-certifications, technology, and billing so that you can focus on your clients.

Partnering with Silver Lining Care

· **Focus on Therapy** – Let us handle the operations as you do what you do best, therapy. Silver Living Care staff will process insurance, work with referral and payer sources, and take all business expenses.

· **Autonomy** – Control your schedule. Work when it is comfortable for you.

· **Credentialing** – Free credentialing with insurance panels for qualified clinicians.

· **Network** with other Mental Health and Healthcare Professionals.

· **Reliable Income** – Thousands of people are looking for counseling services daily. Silver Lining Care can be your primary source of income or a supplement to your existing career.

You are eligible for this position if you are a counselor, psychotherapist, psychologist, art therapist, play therapist, family therapist, child therapist, or other mental health therapist with at least one (1) year of experience providing direct clinical service.

**Be licensed to practice in the state of Illinois, Psychologist (Psy.D or Ph.D) licenses**

Be available to practice a minimum of 12 hours/week;

The therapist will work in coordination with Silver Lining’s outpatient counseling and psychiatric nurses to provide psychotherapy services to adult and youth clients with behavioral health issues.

Services may include a combination of office- based and telehealth to serve clients at remote locations.

**Offering high percentage split, independence and flexible schedule! Come and join our Silver Lining Family!**

The therapist will work in collaboration with office manager to coordinate client care, assist with insurance pre-authorization, and caseload management.

**Job Requirements and Qualifications:**

Minimum Required Education:

· At least 1 year providing direct client care to persons receiving treatment for psychiatric disorders

· Ability to work with both older adult and youth/child populations.

Preferred Experience:

· 1+ years of experience as a **Neuropsychologist** provider

· Experience in telemedicine

Licenses/Certifications:

* Doctorate in Psychology from an Accredited University
* Illinois-licensed
* Training and experience in neuropsychological assessment
* No suspension/exclusion/debarment from participation in federal health care programs (e.g. Medicare, Medicaid, SCHIP)
* Maintain credentials and licensure with all major insurance companies and licensing boards with the assistance of Silver Lining credentialing staff.

**Other Skills Required:**

· Experience in delivering high-quality, client-centered care

· Able to document and navigate EHR independently

· Ability to maintain strict client confidentiality

· Ability to effectively communicate and interact with individuals involved in all aspects of programming: children, parents, school faculty and staff, grantors, funders, partner agencies, members of the community and Silver Lining team members

· Proficient computer skills, including working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

· Ability to work effectively on multidisciplinary team

· Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze and interpret general and professional documents. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one on one and small group situations

· Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action

· Ability to foster teamwork; train and direct the work of team members and colleagues

· Excellent organizational skills, including the ability to work productively and make independent

**Working Conditions / Environment:**

* 1099 contractual employee.
* Flexibility in setting work schedule
* Minimum 12 hours per week

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

Adult neuropsychologist.

Provides neuropsychological evaluations for a range of referral sources including neurology, primary care, and psychiatry, for patients with a wide range of diagnoses and a wide range of cognitive and memory deficits

Provides a full range of psychological assessment services and diagnoses mental disorders for patients appropriate to practice setting

Provides education to patients, family members, caregivers and significant others

Provides consultation to community providers, concerning clinical assessment findings and appropriate treatment plans for patients

Develops, implements, and documents the psychotherapeutic treatment plan for patients involved with mental health services.

Assumes complete professional responsibility for his/her clinical assessment findings, patient care decisions, and documentation

Demonstrates and implements culturally competent practices in both assessment and therapy intervevention

Collaborate with counselors, physicians, or other treatment team members to coordinate client care.

Responsible for timely and accurate completion of medical records, including assessment, treatment plan, progress notes, outcome measures, and billing entries.

Design/participate in the development of individualized treatment plans, incorporating best and leading practices into treatment interventions.

Collaborate with guardians, relatives, and significant others on client’s conditions and treatment when clinically appropriate.

Prepare and submit assessments, progress notes, reports, and summaries to entities/agencies (funders, insurance companies, etc.) as required.

Return calls and emails promptly (within 24 hours of receipt or sooner if clinically necessary)

Responsible for making independent decisions based on protocols developed utilizing national guidelines for treatment interventions.

Responsible for maintaining customer relations with all agency staff and clients.

Records all services performed for accurate billing for services provided in compliance with all local, state and federal laws, as well as payor rules and regulations. Submits billing documents in a timely fashion.

Looks for ways to improve and promote quality. Provides teaching and education to clinical staff, if requested.

Follow all procedures and protocols as per Silver Lining’s policy, federal and state regulations, and standard Practice.

**Offering high percentage split, independence, and flexible schedule!**

· **Become a healthcare recruiter** – Earn additional income by referring clinicians to our Silver Lining family.

title: Clinical Psychologist (Adult Autism Focus)
description:
**About us**

Prosper Health is a telehealth provider of therapy to autistic adults. We are bridging the gap for the estimated 2 million autistic adults in the US with unmet mental health needs by making therapy and autism diagnoses more accessible and affordable. We help mental health professionals, whether they have previous experience or not, provide world class care to autistic individuals.

**To apply please go to this link -** https://boards.greenhouse.io/prosperhealth/jobs/4244321007

**The role:**

* Prosper Health is hiring outstanding psychologists (e.g., PhDs, PsyDs) for a remote, full-time or part-time position.
* In this role, you will provide autism assessments via telehealth to adults. As we innovate by making adult autism assessments affordable and accessible, you will have the opportunity to contribute to developing best-practices and new approaches to assessing for autism in adults.
* Prosper Health handles the insurance billing, provides supervision and guidance, and finds clients — all you have to do is focus on supporting your clients.
* We are looking for neurodiversity affirming candidates who care deeply about helping autistic adults and are excited about joining a fast-growing startup that is on a mission to change the way autistic adults can achieve and flourish in our society.
* To apply, reach out to ben@prosperhealth.io with your resume, LinkedIn, or Psychology Today profile (or similar).

**Our approach to care:** Our care is built on three fundamental pillars:

* *Neurodiversity affirming:* We celebrate the differences in the way people think, and we take a strength-based approach to help our clients achieve their goals.
* *Respecting Autonomy:* We support adults and part of that is recognizing our clients as in charge of their own life. We emphasize autonomy and consent in everything we do.
* *Personalized:* We build our services around our clients as individuals, recognizing that not everyone will want or require the same kind of support. It's our clients’ life - we're here to help with what they think matters.

**Our team:** We are partnering with the autistic community and world-class clinicians to create the best care model possible. Our team consists of members like Ari Ne’eman (founder of the Autistic Self-Advocacy Network) and Rachel Loftin (faculty at Yale and Northwestern medical schools).

title: Clinical Psychologist for ADOS testing
description:
Firefly Therapy Clinic (FFTC) is seeking a part time contract doctoral psychologist to work in-clinic 1 day per week in developmental and behavioral pediatrics. Join our interdisciplinary team of Speech, Occupational, and Applied Behavioral therapist and other support staff.

- Conduct diagnostic evaluations and assessments to determine mental health conditions and develop treatment plans  
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as physicians and social workers, to coordinate care for clients  
- Utilize evidence-based treatment modalities to address a range of mental health concerns, including PTSD, developmental disabilities, and autism spectrum disorders  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records of client assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and other relevant documentation

This position includes primary responsibility for independent administration, scoring, and interpretation of psychological testing for children and adolescents. The psychologist develops recommendations for treatment and links children to education and therapeutic services. Other duties include: counseling families regarding assessment findings and referrals. Test administration is based on an understanding of age, culture, and developmental level. The psychologist documents patient care in the clinical record according to regulatory agency guidelines. Additional job duties may include supervision and training of non-licensed staff and collaborative work with pediatricians and community organizations.

The candidate must possess a doctorate degree in clinical, developmental, or school psychology with a South Carolina state license, or license eligible in South Carolina. Your post-doctoral education must include training and experience in developmental evaluations. Preferred qualification include, 2 years post licensure experience, one year of pediatric experience with children under the age of 6, recent experience in a pediatric setting, and use of competency tests such as Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule Second Edition (ADOS-2) and cognitive measures.  
- Stay informed about current research and developments in the field of psychology to ensure the use of best practices in treatment

Requirements

- Doctoral degree in psychology (Ph.D. or Psy.D.) from an accredited institution

-Certification in Autism Diagnostic Observation Schedule Second Edition (ADOS-2)

- Valid state license to practice as a psychologist  
- Experience working with children and adolescents in a clinical setting  
- Proficiency in conducting diagnostic evaluations and assessments using standardized measures  
- Knowledge of evidence-based treatment modalities for various mental health conditions  
- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to establish rapport with clients and their families  
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills  
- Ability to work collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team

Provides supervision of doctoral candidate students and BCBA clinicians administering autism specific assessments as needed. Clinical work overseen by Senior Director of Diagnostic Operations to assure compliance to legal and ethical standards of practice.

title: PAID psychotherapy preceptor -LMHC, PsyD, Psychologist (Onsite or virtual)
description:
**Urgent need for Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner preceptors** 

**Please read before applying:** 

**We are looking for LICENSED psychologist, licensed clinical social worker, licensed professional counselor, licensed marriage and family therapist or other designated state licensed psychotherapists. Earn additional income doing what you already do by allowing a Nurse Practitioner student to observe therapy sessions and ask questions!** 

1. You must already have an employer that will allow you to precept a student. This can be on site or virtually. Please note, we do not supply the clinical site.

2. You must have an existing caseload of at least 1 patient/client per hour for therapy.

3. You must be Master's prepared or higher, with an active license in good standing.

4. If you work on a virtual platform, you must be able to add a student to your patient/client visits.

5. If you work onsite, you must be able to allow students to sit in on your patient/client visits.

-------

WE NEED YOUR HELP!! There is a NATIONWIDE preceptor shortage. Preceptors serve as a key component of success for Nurse Practitioner students while they learn skills that require hands-on teaching and focused learning. **Preceptors must have an advanced level of clinical acumen, enjoy teaching and work at a clinical site that will allow for NP students.** 

Why precept with MatchNP? Earn compensation for every student you precept. Preceptor paperwork is simplified. Clinical objectives communicated prior to student start date.

The experience of precepting is rewarding. Preceptors maintain clinical knowledge and skills necessary to be an effective preceptor. May be eligible for CME or state tax credits (state dependent). Most importantly, though, you are HELPING a student reach the finish line.

Nurse Practitioner students will come from the Psychiatric Mental Health Nurse Practitioner clinical track.

**Requirements:**

**-Must have clearance from clinical site to precept students prior to applying.** 

-Hold active certification as an PsyD, PhD, LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LMHC provider for at least 1 year.

-Currently working as a therapist or social worker for at least 1 year

-Work in a clinical setting that can offer a rotation in Psych/mental health (on-site or virtually).

**Preferred qualification:**

-Previous experience as a preceptor

**Additional benefits:**

**\\*Earn extra income doing what you already do.**

\\*We pre-screen the students to ensure they meet criteria. We want the preceptors to have a positive experience as well.

\\*New to precepting? We can mentor and share educational materials to help.

\\*We provide 24/7 support during your student's rotation.

\\*We simplify the student's clinical paperwork for your convenience.

title: Psychologist Level II *Provisional*
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**Job Responsibilities:**

* Provides direct face-to-face and/or remote patient care for caseload of assigned and referred patients.
* Provides psychological evaluation and support to patients engaging in treatment for chemical dependency addictions and related disorders.
* Participates as an integral member of multi-disciplinary treatment team.
* Evaluates and provides individual and group psychotherapy for individuals enrolled in the program.
* Creates safe, therapeutic environments for patients with addictions and substance use disorders.
* Utilizes motivational interviewing techniques to support lifestyle changes.
* Develops and documents treatment plans.
* Develops differential diagnoses for patients.
* Coordinates with psychiatrists, social workers, addictions counselors when in managing patient's overall care.
* Participates and leads various group meetings as assigned.
* Provide documentation of clinical services as per departmental and hospital guidelines.
* Performs all other duties assigned by Supervisor and/or designee.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


For Appointment to Assignment to Level II:  

1. Valid license and current registration to practice as a Psychologist issued by the NYSED; or  

2. Proof of passing licensing examination and proof that completed license application and all supporting documentation have been submitted to NYSED, which leads to licensure and registration, within six (6) months.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Clinical Psychologist (Psy.D./Ph
description:
**About us**

At HIAAH, we're not just a mental health practice—we're a community of passionate professionals committed to transforming lives. As a leading provider of behavioral health services across multiple states, we offer comprehensive mental wellness services, psychiatry, and family counseling. Our practice thrives in a social, innovative, and collaborative environment, and we take pride in delivering high-quality care that goes beyond expectations.

**Why Join HIAAH:**

* **Dynamic and Inclusive Culture:** Be part of a team that values diversity, innovation, and collaboration. Our inclusive environment fosters creativity and growth.
* **Cutting-Edge Therapeutic Approaches:** Embrace the opportunity to apply the latest therapeutic interventions grounded in empirical research and clinical expertise. We prioritize staying at the forefront of advancements in mental health care.
* **Individualized Patient Care:** Join a practice that is dedicated to tailoring treatments to the unique needs of each patient. We believe in the power of personalized care to make a lasting impact.
* **Career Development:** HIAAH is invested in the professional growth of our team members. Benefit from ongoing training, mentorship, and opportunities for advancement within our expanding practice.

HIAAH is seeking a qualified and experienced Clinical Psychologist with a Psy.D. or Ph.D. to join our dynamic team. As a leading mental health provider, we are dedicated to delivering high-quality, compassionate care to our clients.

**Qualifications:**

* Doctoral degree (Psy.D. or Ph.D.) in Clinical Psychology from an accredited institution.
* State licensure as a Psychologist.
* Demonstrated experience in conducting psychological assessments and providing evidence-based therapy.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
* Commitment to ethical standards and confidentiality.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct comprehensive psychological assessments and evaluations.
* Provide individual and group therapy sessions to clients with diverse backgrounds and mental health needs.
* Develop and implement effective treatment plans based on assessment findings.
* Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals to ensure integrated and holistic care.
* Stay current with advancements in the field of psychology through continuing education and professional development.
* Maintain accurate and confidential client records in compliance with legal and ethical standards.

company: Blue Square Counseling and Wellness Center
description:
**Job Description:** Clinical Team Member (CTM) - BlueSquare

**About the Company:** If you often think: ***I wish I were more supported in my work and felt valued as a critical component in the care of my clients.*** Then let’s talk!

Clinicians are the primary focus at Blue Square. Our practice celebrates and supports our clinicians both personally and professionally so they can focus on providing the best quality care possible to the clients they see.

Some of the ways Blue Square does things differently:

* Extended onboarding support that includes mentoring and a transition period into the private practice environment
* Monthly collaboration and case consultations
* Regular training that hones skills and expertise
* Flexible scheduling to encourage work / life harmony while still maintaining adequate client load and practice needs
* Education stipends to build expertise
* Supportive leadership that provides learning and growth opportunities
* Weekly paid time for self-care

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Clinical Team Member to join our dynamic mental health clinic. The Clinical Team Member will ensure the delivery of high-quality care to our clients. The successful candidate will possess clinical expertise and a passion for promoting mental health.

**Our preference is for hybrid or on-site therapists but we are open to exploring remote only providers if you're a good fit!**

**US BASED APPLICANTS ONLY!**

**We Are Looking For You If You:**

* Love doing psychotherapy. Your clients and the work you do together energizes you.
* Don’t want to worry about where your next client is coming from. We’ve got you covered with a steady stream of referrals.
* Want to work with clients who are a good fit for your practice niche. We will support you in finding your niche and then tailor your client assignments so we are hitting your sweet spot.
* Have a passion for learning and growing as a person and a professional. Being the best takes work, we know that and support you with educational stipends and in-house trainings.
* Know that we need to support one another to be successful. We don’t do negativity or drama.
* Value being part of a team. We invest a lot into our team members and are looking for individuals who want to work for a practice that cares.
* Are committed to inspiring your coworkers, clients and our local communities. We don’t just say we do good work, we engage in the behaviors that support good work.
* Want to be the best therapist you can be. You didn’t get into this field to be ho hum, which means you feel comfortable asking for help and support. We can’t know everything and that’s why we have a team of incredible admins and clinicians to lean on.
* Are available to work two evenings until 7 pm or one evening and one weekend day. We focus on meeting the needs of all our community members and after school and work are the most requested times for therapy.
* Want a work-life balance. We know you need time for you and we want you to have that. Our full-time work week is 30 hours.
* Want more than the status quo mental health practice.
* Are licensed or license eligible in the State of Massachusetts. We have weekly consultation meetings to support our clinical team members and offer supervision toward licensure at no cost for our license eligible team members.

**Qualifications:**

* Master's or Doctoral degree in Psychology or a related field. Licensure as an independent clinician in Massachusetts is good, but we are happy to work with pre-licensed individuals!
* Knowledge of evidence-based therapeutic approaches and interventions for various mental health conditions.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse clients and team members.
* Strong understanding of ethical and legal considerations in mental health practice.
* Proficiency in electronic health records (EHR) and other relevant software applications.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying current with best practices in the field.
* Empathy, cultural competence, and a genuine passion for promoting mental health and well-being.

**The Fine Print:**

* Reimbursement: We are not the highest paying practice in the area. We aren’t the lowest either. We believe in paying a fair and competitive wage and in exchange we offer our employees a ton of support and flexibility.
* We will support, encourage and help pay for you to develop your approved area of specialization.
* We encourage you to grow your clinical skills and be more than a sit and chat therapist
* We market you so you become known as an authority and resource in our local communities in your field of specialization.
* We can fill your caseload as long as you know how to retain a client.
* We do things for our team members because we care, not because we have to.
* We do all the un-fun stuff that makes the business run (billing, client screening, insurance verification, answering the phone, marketing, buying supplies so it's always in the office waiting for you like coffee, tissues and toilet paper!)
* Time Off: All of our team members receive paid time off and paid sick time.
* Birthday Holiday: All team members are given a floating holiday as a birthday present!
* Health Benefits: Medical, dental, and vision benefits available for our full time team members.
* Retirement: 401K plan available to all of our team members
* Life Insurance: Life insurance available to all of our team members

Ready to apply?

***Send us your resume and a cover letter along with the following requested personality profiles to assist us in placing you inside our team of providers to hello @ bluesquarecounseling.com.***

**https://www.123test.com/disc-personality-test/** - super easy and straightforward test, just send a screenshot of the pie chart at the end

**https://personalitymax.com/personality-test/** - a little longer test, you can send us the PDF or URL provided to you at the end. This test is FREE. If you are asked to pay at any point make sure you are on the correct URL. **People have clicked on the ads in the past instead of the test and it takes them somewhere else.**

title: Senior Director, Behavioral Health
description:
**Included Health** is a new kind of healthcare company, delivering integrated virtual care and navigation. We’re on a mission to raise the standard of healthcare for everyone. We break down barriers to provide high-quality care for every person in every community — no matter where they are in their health journey or what type of care they need, from acute to chronic, behavioral to physical. We offer our members care guidance, advocacy, and access to personalized virtual and in-person care for everyday and urgent care, primary care, behavioral health, and specialty care. It’s all included.  

  

In partnership with Senior Leadership, the **Senior Director, Behavioral Health** sets a 2-3 year strategic vision for Included Health’s Therapy and Psychiatry service lines. This individual will coach and mentor their leaders and clinical teams to execute against the strategic vision and deliver outcomes and greater health for our members. In addition to driving service line performance, this leader will partner with other clinical service lines within Included Health’s ecosystem, sponsoring and supporting clinical integration and innovation across Behavioral Health, Care Management, Primary Care, and Specialty offerings.  

As the senior Behavioral Health leader, the role will also represent Included Health in external meetings, conferences, and with potential partners, representing and expounding upon Included Health’s vision of behavioral health and integrated care delivery.  

This position will report to the SVP, Clinical Services, at Included Health.
### **What you’ll Do:**

* This individual is ultimately accountable for sponsoring Psychiatry (medication management) and Therapy practices that:
* Deliver safe, high quality, efficient clinical services that improve health outcomes for engaged individuals
* Deliver a clinical experience that drives appropriate patient retention and cross-utilization, and
* Attract and retain a diverse, top pool of clinicians and talent that align with company vision and goals
* Dedicate approximately 8 hours per month to clinical care to patients on the platform; in the course of clinical duties, the individual will display exemplary levels of professionalism and clinical quality in all dealings with patients, and will maintain and complete charting and documentation in a timely manner.

  

* Creatively use data to inform decisions, where available, but also uses content knowledge, stakeholder input, and experience to guide decisions in its absence.
* Serve as the voice of the service line in internal meetings and key external conversations, translating day-to-day work into themes, priorities, and narrative.
* Partner with multidisciplinary stakeholders on key program strategy and design features to ensure the service line is optimized for clinical outcomes, member experience, scale, and provider experience. Serves as a champion of Therapy and Psychiatry services, but actively seeks opportunities to reduce seams between teams and services and find common themes.
* Partner with the Clinical Quality Team to ensure that quality assurance efforts and operational processes support the delivery of safe, high-quality clinical care on their service lines.
* Serve as a voice for clinical quality and patient safety in broader Included Health interactions.
* Represent products and services in external meetings with prospects and clients, engaging in tactical and strategic discussions around program improvement and innovation.
* Other duties, as assigned

### **Qualifications:**

* 2+ years experience leading a diverse clinical behavioral health practice, inclusive of medication management and therapy components. Experience working in conjunction with care management and/or primary care is welcomed.
* Demonstrated experience successfully driving programmatic and clinical operational change through direct leadership and influence across clinical and non-clinical stakeholders.
* Able to effectively communicate in a variety of formats and styles.
* Natural ability to create effective relationships, influence, and collaborate.
* Able to operate comfortably and effectively in ambiguity.
* Passionate about improving the quality and experience of clinical care delivered in the US healthcare system
* Adhere to legal and ethical requirements and company policies and procedures.
* Prepared to stay up-to-date with continuing education, including knowledge of evidence-based psychosocial interventions and psychiatric medications.

* **Education:**
* If Psychiatrist, completion of ACGME-accredited psychiatry residency program and Board Certification
* If Psychologist, Doctoral degree (PhD or PsyD) from an APA accredited Psychology Program, and 2+ years of unsupervised / post licensure experience post-doctorate
* Active and unrestricted state medical license in home state; multi-state licenses preferred
* Not under current exclusion or sanction by any state or federal health care program, including Medicare or Medicaid, and is not identified as an “excluded person” by the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Health and Human Services or the General Service Administration (GSA), or reprimanded or sanctioned by Medicare
* Must not be opted out of Medicare
* Completion of U.S. Medical Licensing Examination

* **Physical Requirements:**
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
* This job operates in a professional, private and secure, HIPAA-compliant home office
* Must be able to use manual dexterity while using office equipment such as computers, laptops, keyboard, and mouse
* This position requires frequent communication with patients and physicians must be able to exchange accurate information during these patient encounters.
* Specific identifying abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus
* Overnight Business travel required

  

The United States new hire base salary target range for this full-time position is:  

$174,970 - $279,950 (yearly salary), in addition to equity + benefits + bonus  

This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for candidates based on their respective Zone. Below is additional information on Included Health's commitment to maintaining transparent and equitable compensation practices across our distinct geographic zones.  

Starting base salary for the successful candidate will depend on several job-related factors, unique to each candidate, which may include, but not limited to, education; training; skill set; years and depth of experience; certifications and licensure; business needs; internal peer equity; organizational considerations; and alignment with geographic and market data. Compensation structures and ranges are tailored to each zone's unique market conditions to ensure that all employees receive fair and competitive compensation based on their roles and locations. *Your Recruiter can share your geographic zone alignment upon inquiry.*  

In addition to earning a base salary, this role is eligible for a performance-based bonus. Details of the Annual Bonus Plan, including performance metrics, target incentives, and potential earnings, will be discussed during the interview process. **Benefits & Perks**
In addition to receiving a competitive base salary, the compensation package may include, depending on the role, the following:  

Remote-first culture
401(k) savings plan through Fidelity
Comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage through multiple medical plan options (including disability insurance)
Full suite of Included Health telemedicine (e.g. behavioral health, urgent care, etc.) and health care navigation products and services offered at no cost for employees and dependents
Generous Paid Time Off ("PTO") and Discretionary Time Off (“DTO")
12 weeks of 100% Paid Parental leave
Up to $25,000 Fertility and Family Building Benefit
Compassionate Leave (paid leave for employees who experience a failed pregnancy, surrogacy, adoption or fertility treatment)
11 Holidays Paid with one Floating Paid Holiday
Work-From-Home reimbursement to support team collaboration and effective home office work
24 hours of Paid Volunteer Time Off (“VTO”) Per Year to Volunteer with Charitable Organizations *Your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range and benefits package for your role during the hiring process.* **About Included Health**  

Included Health is a new kind of healthcare company, delivering integrated virtual care and navigation. We’re on a mission to raise the standard of healthcare for everyone. We break down barriers to provide high-quality care for every person in every community — no matter where they are in their health journey or what type of care they need, from acute to chronic, behavioral to physical. We offer our members care guidance, advocacy, and access to personalized virtual and in-person care for everyday and urgent care, primary care, behavioral health, and specialty care. It’s all included. Learn more at**includedhealth.com****.**-*Included Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Included Health considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.*

title: Remote Clinical Counselor
description:
**\\*\\*This position requires the selected candidates to be within 100 miles of a Naval Installation in the region they are supporting. To meet that requirement for this opening, you must be within 100 miles of a Naval Installation in one of the following locations: \\*\\***


* **Kitsap, WA**
* **Bremerton, WA**
* **Everett, WA**
* **Whidbey Island, WA**
* **Point Loma, CA**
* **Lemoore, CA**
* **Monterey, CA**
* **Coronado, CA**
* **Ventura, CA**
* **San Diego, CA**
* **Ventura County, CA**


**Job Title:** Remote Clinical Counselor


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Scope of practice is limited to counseling services for Other Conditions That May Be a Focus of Clinical Attention and Adjustment Disorders.
* Ensure referral for appropriate behavioral health follow-up of any psychological disorders or symptoms requiring longer-term and/or medical/psychiatric intervention. Conduct intake, screening, assessment, and referral of clients as appropriate. Work with the client to establish an individual treatment plan. Provide individual and couples, and group counseling. Provide information about existing Navy programs such as NMC Counseling Services at the sites. Provide immediate intervention and risk assessment IAW best practices in the mental health community and educate and ensure adequate referral and follow-up of any case presenting suicidal or homicidal risk.
* Perform accurate assessment of the client’s presenting problem and plan effective treatment for that problem.
* Provide an initial clinical assessment and ongoing risk assessments using the Columbia Suicide Severity Risk Scale (C-SSRS). Provide ongoing safety planning using the Veterans Affairs Safety Plan.
* Report suspected child abuse and domestic abuse/violence to the local civilian authorities and the Family Advocacy Representative IAW Navy and state requirements.
* Coordinate and manage specialized assessment and intervention services for children and families not associated with met criteria incidents of child abuse/neglect or domestic abuse.
* Provide a warm handoff to the Family Advocacy Representative or FAP Victim Advocate for clients wanting to make a restricted domestic abuse report.
* Provide a warm handoff to the Sexual Assault Response Coordinator or SAPR Victim Advocate for clients wanting to make a restricted sexual assault report.
* Intervene in crisis situations, using sound professional judgment, ethical practice, and common sense.
* Remote Clinical Counselors may be authorized to provide temporary surge support (telephonically and through Navy authorized virtual platforms) across additional Navy Regions when there is an increased number of cases within a region. All efforts should be made to provide appointments in the time zone of the Sailor’s location.
* Participate in regional quarterly quality assurance procedures to ensure that all clinical services provided are safe and of good quality.
* Maintain counseling case documentation in the FFSMIS Clinical Counseling Record System for all non-medical counseling assessment and counseling services IAW all applicable policies, laws, and instructions.
* Ensure all non-medical counseling services are accounted for in the FFSMIS scheduling module.


**Required Education and/or Experience Qualifications**


* Must be physically located within 100 miles of a Navy installation in the assigned area of responsibility.
* Minimum educational qualifications include one of the following; a master’s degree in counseling accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs; a master’s degree in social work accredited by the Council on Social Work Education, a master’s degree in marriage and family therapy accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Marriage and Family Therapy Education, or a doctoral degree in clinical or counseling psychology and a one-year clinical internship accredited by the American Psychological Association.
* Current, valid and unrestricted clinical license or certification from a state or U.S. territory authorizing independent clinical practice in the fields of professional counseling, clinical social work, marriage and family therapy or clinical/counseling psychology- LCSW (Licensed Clinical Social Worker), LMFT (Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist), LCP (Licensed Clinical Psychologist/ Licensed PhD in Psychology), LPC (Licensed Professional Counselor), LCPC (Licensed Certified Professional Counselor), LMHC (Licensed Mental Health Counselor)
* Each Remote Clinical Counselor must maintain current clinical credentials and privileges throughout their FFSP assignment.
* A minimum of two years- of full-time, post-master’s supervised clinical experience.
* Remote Clinical Counselors must meet or exceed the requirements for Tier II clinical practitioners.
* Remote Clinical Counselors must meet the standards of professional and ethical conduct prescribed by their particular discipline or licensing board and demonstrate current clinical competence through at least periodic, direct service clinical experience during the 2 years preceding hire.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Knowledge of the difficulties of adjusting to general life stresses as well as those resulting from the requirements of military life, and experience providing short-term counseling for those issues
* Knowledge of standard documentation requirements for clinical services
* Knowledge of available military and community referral resources
* Ability to work effectively with diverse racial, ethnic, and socioeconomic backgrounds
* Proficiency in oral and written communication skills
* Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and skilled in the use of office software Experience working in a virtual environment and competency in telehealth clinical service delivery


**Other Skills and Abilities**


**Requirements:** All positions that require access to U.S. Government facilities and systems require U.S. Citizenship, and reliable transportation to travel to assigned locations and nearby facilities.


**Competencies**



To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:


* **Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.**
* **Customer Service -** Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.
* **Interpersonal Skills -** Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
* **Oral Communication -** Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
* **Written Communication -** Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
* **Change Management -** Develops workable implementation plans; Communicates changes effectively; Builds commitment and overcomes resistance; Prepares and supports those affected by change; Monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Judgment -** Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions.
* **Professionalism -** Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.


**Physical Requirements:** Uses personal computer, telephones, copiers, printers and other office equipment. Sits, stands, bends, lifts, and moves intermittently during working hours. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.


**Work Environment:**

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



Must have a dedicated professional workspace that that provides a secure, private environment suitable for telehealth clinical services and staff supervision and is free of distractions or personal commitments during the workday.


***Zeiders Enterprises, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer***



Pay Rate: $68,000 - $103,000



PLEASE NOTE: The Zeiders pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Clinical Psychologist (Remote)
description:
**About Us:**

At GI Psychology, we are a passionate team of telehealth clinicians dedicated to improving the lives of individuals with gastrointestinal disorders and other complex medical conditions. We provide data-driven interventions and treatments, collaborating closely with interdisciplinary teams to make a meaningful impact for our patients and communities. Our mission is to increase nation-wide access to quality gastro psychology services.

**The Opportunity:** 

Join us in a journey where you can further cultivate your professional and clinical abilities and make a significant impact in advancing the field of health psychology. In this role, you will have the unique opportunity to be at the forefront of delivering highly effective gut-brain psychotherapy while collaborating with expert GI providers throughout the nation. We thrive on continuous learning and consultation, making it an environment where you can truly excel while embodying our core values of integrity, innovation, and interpersonal generosity. Join us in making a meaningful impact on the lives of those in need while advancing your career in a supportive and growth-focused organization.

Our opening for a Clinical Psychologist entails a 35-hour work week, inclusive of 24-26 clinical hours as well as internal and external collaboration, program development, community and provider outreach, and ongoing professional development. With a ‘pick your own schedule’ approach, the sole requirement for the schedule is 8 hours after 4pm EST and/or on the weekends. This clinical psychologist position offers an annual salary starting at $101,000 with opportunity for performance based bonuses. We provide robust clinical support so you can focus on the activities that excite you and have various pathways for advancement and leadership. Virginia licensure and completion of external hypnosis training is required prior to start.

**Who You Are:** 

You are a Licensed Clinical Psychologist who identifies as a life-long learner and is energized by providing outcomes-driven psychotherapy to various age groups. You’re not looking for a transition job; you’re seeking a career where your sophisticated clinical skills and passion for increasing access to specialized behavioral health will be nurtured and valued.

Join us in our mission to increase awareness and utilization of effective treatments for Disorders of the Gut-Brain Interaction. If you're a Clinical Psychologist who is driven by the desire to excel, collaborate, and contribute to meaningful change, we want to hear from you.

**How to Apply:**

Please submit your resume and a letter detailing your motivation to join GI Psychology and how you align with our values. Please note clinical experience

title: Psychotherapist - Remote
description:
Waves Holistic Healing is expanding!

We are seeking new team members to fill the role of Psychotherapist - Full Time (15+ clients per week, on average).

You must have at least three years of relevant experience working one-on-one with clients.

In order to be successful in this role, the following qualities are essential:

* You have a strong sense of self. You know who you are!
* You have a sense of humor.
* You enjoy improvising.
* You are creative.
* You’re grounded.
* Other people would describe you as having strong boundaries, including your clients.
* You have a consistent practice of going to therapy. Or if it’s not therapy, maybe it’s bodywork, energy healing, breathwork sessions, hypnotherapy, yoga, etc. Whatever it is, you are receiving support and are committed to your own personal healing journey. That commitment is represented by a tangible and consistent practice.
* You have a supportive community and supportive relationships.
* You are kind and warm-hearted.
* Your written and spoken communication is clear, organized and easy to understand.
* You see your clients as sovereign beings and respect them authentically.
* You are able to quickly perceive what the root issues are when meeting with clients.
* You have a good relationship with money, and are able to communicate clearly and professionally about financial matters with clients as needed.
* You are receptive to feedback.
* You have your own signature style when it comes to therapy. No one else does it quite like you.
* You know something others don’t. This might be an unpopular or controversial opinion, and it’s evidence that you’re a free-thinker.
* You’re not just in favor of the latest trendy thing. Your heart is genuinely connected to your work and it’s not based on external pressure, guilt, or a need to perform.
* You ask questions.
* You don’t find the typical ‘difficult’ client to be difficult.
* You find yourself energized and not drained by doing therapy. You know how to maintain good energetic boundaries and shake off the heavy stuff in between and after sessions.
* You are independent.
* You’re an avid learner.

Professional growth:

We currently offer clinical supervision, training and professional mentoring to staff therapists. Training may draw from the following practices and theoretical orientations:

* EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing)
* Brainspotting
* Hypnotherapy
* Somatic experiencing
* Emotion release practices
* Ritual practices for trauma, personal and family healing
* Meditation
* Energy healing techniques including Reiki
* Internal Family Systems
* Ayurveda
* Gestalt Therapy

Licensing requirements include:

* If you are an independently licensed clinician (professional counselor, clinical social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family therapist), your license could be active in any state in the US. You can work remotely from anywhere, as long as you’re in compliance with board requirements.
* If you are a provisionally licensed clinician (professional counselor, clinical social worker, clinical psychologist, marriage and family therapist), your license may be active in Illinois, Arizona or Florida. These are the states for which we are currently offering clinical supervision. You can still work remotely from anywhere, as long as you’re in compliance with board requirements.

Bonus:

You have a unique specialization to offer that you could integrate into your work as a therapist. Examples include:

* Breathwork, herbalism, Yoga Teacher Training, fluency in languages other than English, meditation training, facilitation and/or organization of retreats, Ayurveda training, tantra training

title: Licensed Mental Health Clinician (Fertility)
description:
**Who we are:**

Embra Health is a novel mental health company that supports third-party reproduction. We specialize in delivering conscientious mental health assessments for donors, carriers, and intended parents. Our mission is to foster, elevate, and support the unique emotional needs of everyone involved in the transformative journey to parenthood.

**Job Description:** 

Embra Health is currently seeking licensed mental health therapists, counselors, clinical social workers, and psychologists who have an interest and/or background in fertility and third-party reproduction. You would be delivering psychosocial assessments and consultations tailored to individuals involved in egg donation, sperm donation, gestational carriers, and aspiring parenthood. This includes completing a psychosocial interview, administering multiple psychological scales and inventories, and completing a thorough report and clearance. This position is a contract position. Opportunities are available to grow and become a primary evaluator.

**Why Join Embra Health:**

*Keep your practice:* Our model of work allows to continue your main gig, and integrate this opportunity into your current practice, position, or personal schedule. You work as much as you want.

*Autonomy:* You get to choose our availability for appointments, ensuring it aligns with YOUR preferences. You work when you want.

*Flexibility:* All sessions are completed through secure video conferencing, facilitated by a HIPAA-compliant Telehealth platform.

*Mentorship:* Benefit from comprehensive training and mentoring that equips you with advanced assessment tools designed for a thorough evaluation of patients within the infertility domain.

*Training:* Not only are you offered extensive training upfront but will also be granted an education stipend to use toward CEUs and professional development.

*The Ultimate Gift:* Offering psychosocial assessments within our group means you are part of the journey toward parenthood for an aspiring parent/ parents. Adds so much value and importance to the work.

**Required Skills:**

-Hold one of the following licenses: Psychologist (PsyD/ PhD), Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC).

-Possess a master's degree from an accredited college or university in a relevant field.

-Maintain active and independent state licensure, with the ability to practice without supervision.

-Demonstrate coverage under malpractice insurance with a minimum of $1 million per occurrence and $3 million in aggregate coverage.

-Active membership with your licensing board.

-Possess prior experience in Telehealth and have access to a personal computer for remote sessions.

**Bonus skills:**

Proficiency in offering services in languages beyond English.

Licensure in multiple states (specific states we are looking for are HI, IA, AK, LA, MS, MT)

*We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. Every application will be thoughtfully reviewed. Please note that while we appreciate all applications, only candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted. We are urgently hiring and encourage you to submit your resume if interested. We want to meet you, asap! We appreciate your interest in becoming a part of Embra Health's team.*

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $100.00 - $150.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work setting:

* Remote
* Telehealth

Application Question(s):

* What licensure do you actively hold?
* What state(s) are you currently licensed in?
* How long have you been actively licensed?
* What is your “main gig” right now?
* Do you have background working with fertility, or is this a new interest? (no wrong answers here)
* Do you speak any languages outside of English?
* You would need to devote at least 5-15 hours a week to Embra Health, and as we ramp up, you may be asked for more time. Would this work for you with your current setup?
* In this contract role, you will be paid a fee-per-service only. This means you are paid for a completed evaluation, ranging from $100-$250. This is not an hourly or salaried rate. Depending on your licensure and state, you can range from 1-10+ evaluations a week. Would this work for you?
* There is an opportunity to become a primary evaluator. This would mean you work for us primarily (doing 15+ evaluations a week). Would you be interested in this type of opportunity at this time?
* Do you have any questions for us?

title: Remote Trauma Therapist
description:
**Aloha! We are a Hawaii-based Holistic and Integrative Psychotherapy & Psychiatry Center looking for Psychologists/LMHC/LCSW/LMFTs who are trained in specific trauma healing modalities to serve the community of Hawaii. You must have or be willing to apply for a Hawaiian License for this job.**

**Our mission** is to support people to become who they truly are, heal their deepest wounds at the root causes, and to live a fulfilling and meaningful life.

We would be honored to have you join us in fulfilling this mission together and supporting the community of the Hawaiian islands. Come work with your ideal clients and create your own schedule supported by a team of open-hearted and highly-skilled Therapists. We are hiring full-time and part-time (**at least 15 client sessions per week**) licensed therapists to treat clients in a private practice setting in Kailua, Hawaii on Oahu. This job can be performed remotely through HIPAA-secure Telehealth.

This is a **flexible position** where therapists can create their own ideal schedule. You will need to have one of these **Hawaii Licenses** for this position: Licensed Psychologist, Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW, Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist LMFT, or Licensed Mental Health Counselor LMHC.

We are a husband and wife team who are both psychotherapists and looking to hire compassionate, caring, highly-skilled Psychologists or Psychotherapists to join our practice as Independent Contractors.

**We will provide as many Hawaii-based clients as you would like to work with**, **Intake Team** that takes care of paperwork and up front dealings with clients, **Remote Group Clinical Supervision**, a **loving and supportive community** to be a part of, and **easy insurance billing** with our practice management software.

**Remote Group Supervision** starts with a meditation that we lead. Then, everyone gets to check in and share how they are doing in their lives and be supported by all of us. Then, we celebrate successes with clients and then bring up any cases or support needed around clients. We all share our wisdom and offerings. We are truly a little Ohana (family) and create lots of connection during this time where we all laugh together and cry together.

**We believe our job is to support our Providers to give their soul gifts to the world. We believe therapy is an art and we are here to empower our Therapists to evolve and grow in their art form. We hire rockstar Therapists that we trust and let them do their thing!** 

**Great centrally located Kailua Location (if you are ever in Hawaii)**: We have 5 newly renovated office suites on the 2nd level of the Davis Building across from Kalapawai Cafe.

The position is for a minimum of 1 year. You must be an American citizen to be considered for this job position.

**Job Responsibilities**:

* Providing psychotherapy services
* Scheduling with clients
* Conducting new client intake and assessment
* Taking progress notes on each session
* Collecting and recording payments

**Job Requirements**:

1. Licensed in the State of Hawaii

2. Trained in either:

* Specific trauma healing modality, such as EMDR, Internal Family Systems (IFS) Therapy, Somatic Experiencing (SE), Sensorimotor, Brainspotting, Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), Comprehensive Resource Model (CRM), Integrative Body Psychotherapy (IBP), etc.
* OR a specific Couples Therapy modality such as PACT, EFT, Gottman, Imago, etc.

**Qualities Required from Applicants**:

* Loving & Open-Hearted
* Compassionate
* Dedicated to each client’s growth
* Confident in clinical abilities
* Responsible
* Trustworthy
* Pro-Active and Motivated
* Able to stay on top of notes and billing
* Authentic
* Open-minded
* Clear communicator
* Willing to ask for support when needed
* Able to quickly build rapport and connection with new clients

**To apply, please** ***submit your resume and cover letter and answer all the following questions including the Phone Interview Questions (Indeed will send that request to you separately):***

**What specific trauma healing modalities are you trained in?**

**What therapeutic modalities do you utilize with clients?**

**What client populations do you work with (age range, couples, families, kids etc)?** 

**How many hours per week are you looking to see clients?** 

**Why are you interested in this position and how can you contribute to our community of therapists?**

Mahalo and we greatly look forward to hearing from you!

title: Psychological Evaluator
description:
**Job Title: Psychological Evaluator - Personal Injury Trauma Cases**

**Company:** Mental Pain and Trauma Center, LLC

**Location:** Dallas, Texas (Virtual)

**Job Type:** Full-time/Part-Time, Contract

**About Us:**  
Mental Pain and Trauma Center is a leading provider of comprehensive psychological services, dedicated to supporting individuals coping with personal injury trauma. Our team of professionals is committed to delivering high-quality assessments and evaluations to ensure quality of service and direction of psychotherapy treatment plan. The evaluator will not be doing psychotherapy.

**Job Description:**

We are currently seeking a skilled and empathetic Psychological Evaluator to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting thorough psychological assessments for individuals involved in personal injury cases. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in trauma-focused evaluations and be capable of providing insightful and comprehensive reports.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct in-depth psychological assessments for clients involved in personal injury cases.
* Collaborate with legal teams, healthcare professionals, and other stakeholders to gather relevant information.
* Administer and interpret psychological tests to evaluate the impact of trauma on individuals.
* Provide evidence-based recommendations for treatment and intervention strategies.
* Compile detailed and comprehensive reports summarizing evaluation findings.
* Testify in court as an expert witness when required.
* Stay current on the latest research and developments in the field of trauma psychology.

**Qualifications:**

* Doctoral degree (Ph.D. or Psy.D.) in Clinical Psychology or a related field.
* Licensed or license-eligible as a psychologist in the state of Texas or member of PSYPAC.
* Experience in conducting psychological evaluations.
* Strong knowledge of trauma-focused assessment tools.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Bilingual Spanish is a plus.

**How to Apply:**  
Please show interest on Indeed if you are interested.
