title: Mental Health Technician
description:
**Vacancy for MANAGER, OPERATIONS, MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS, BANGALORE**

We are looking for an experienced, cheerful and confident Female candidate in the 30+ years age group, who has a Master’s Degree in Counseling Psychology or Clinical Psychology. Advanced Diploma / M Phil in Child Psychology will be an asset. She must have at least 3-5 years of experience of working with children and leading a team. The candidate should be comfortable using IT tools, fluent in English and willing to travel within the city. Knowledge of Kannada will be an asset.

SPECIFIC SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

**Key Skills/Attributes:**

**1.** **Should have a background in child psychology and work experience**

**2.** **Should be very good at managing a team of psychologists and coordinating with other teams in the organization.**

**3.** **Should have the ability to plan the micro details of operations.**

**4.** **Should be a very good trouble shooter, with a cool head on his/her shoulders.**

**5.** **Willingness to travel through the city to different schools for meetings and program delivery at times.**

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

You, as Manager, Operations, Mental Health Programs, Bangalore will be the leading AddressHealth’s school mental wellbeing programs in Bangalore. You will work closely with Manager, Operations, Health Education to help deliver AddressHealth’s health education program and have several team members who work across both teams. You will report to the Senior Manager, Operations, Bangalore.

The following are the key duties & responsibilities of the incumbent:

* Make regular visits to schools allocated, to act as visiting school counselor to address concerns and problems of particular children.
* Act as a resource person/facilitator for group therapy / workshops for children identified to be at risk
* Act as a resource person for a capacity building workshops for teachers , school counselors and parents
* Ensure that service schedules are maintained and operations protocols are adhered to by mental health team
* Train AddressHealth Health Education and Mental Wellbeing team resources on handling children and operational protocols.
* Maintain the quality of service delivery and ensuring adherence to service standards;
* Work in close coordination with Health Education team and provide personnel time for health education from mental health resources, including your own time.
* Being the single point of contact for donor funded mental wellbeing programs in school.
* Prompt and diligent reporting

**ABOUT THE COMPANY**

Set up in March 2010, AddressHealth is today, India’s largest school health provider, having partnered with more than 400 schools and serving over 4 lakh children. AddressHealth offers comprehensive health checks, infirmary services, a health education curriculum & mental wellness programs to schools in urban India. In its efforts to make the pediatric primary healthcare continuum possible, AddressHealth is partnered with venture funds in the social impact space like Gray Matters Capital and Unitus Seed Fund. AddressHealth is also a winner of “The Stars in Global Health-7” awarded by the Grand Challenges Canada. Our Head office is in Bangalore. We also serve schools in Delhi NCR, Pune, Hyderabad and several other locations. AddressHealth has been an implementing partner for Live Love Laugh Foundation’s “ You are Not Alone’ Program in Bangalore and Pune and has covered over 17000 children in AY 22-23.Its health education program, which includes mental health will cover more than 75000 children in 23-24

**Remuneration:**The salary for this position will range between 30,000/- to 40,000/- pm. In addition, there will be a fixed food and travel reimbursements. Incentives of Upto 10% of gross salary can be expected ongood performance annually.

**To attend the intervew whatsapp your updated CV with present address details to 9591990945, HR Dept.**

* Day shift

* total work: 3 years (Required)

Location:

* Bangalore, Karnataka (Required)

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
The Hans Foundation, established in 2009, is a Public Charitable Trust that that works for the improvement of quality of life for underprivileged communities across India through Health, Education, Livelihood and Disability sector interventions. THF undertakes direct implementation of projects on the ground in addition to providing funding support to not-for-profit organisations in India through its donor – RIST, USA. THF’s Strategic planning focuses on key areas of its work with the aim of addressing the key issues of poverty alleviation, economic inequalities, and 360° impact on the quality of life through social development programs. THF’s programs are majorly implemented in the most rural and under-developed areas in the country. Over the years, THF has expanded its charitable activities in collaboration with State and Central Governments, institutions, corporates, academia and non-government organizations for sustainable interventions to achieve scale and economy. The interventions implemented by the foundation range from grass root level to national level programs. **Background of the Project****Project: Holding hands in magical years: early childhood development & Neuro-rehabilitation Centre.***(A novel multidisciplinary initiative with collaboration of The Hans Foundation & Centre of Excellence and Advanced Research for Childhood Neurodevelopmental Disorders, Child Neurology Division, Department of Pediatrics, AIIMS, New Delhi)***The early the better”** believing in this approach, The Hans Foundation has been supporting a number of projects to facilitate the early years of development. It provides supportive services to children and adult with disabilities who more often lack access to the comprehensive and intensified services in those magical years of development and also needed across the lifespan. This approach dramatically improves individual’s chances to reach their full potential and functioning, have better quality of life and take up their right place in the society as adults. The Hans Foundation is creating more such facilities and services in the country to reach the last mile of targeted community while aiming to achieve the goal **“*****People with disability are enjoying a meaningful life in the inclusive society with high humanistic values”.***  

This project would be operated from a Centre established near to AIIMS Delhi for providing array of services: assessment and diagnosis, early intervention, neuro developmental therapies, healthcare and rehabilitation, multidisciplinary interventions which is part of our broader effort to improve the lives of all children and adults with disabilities and to support reforms in the social system. The project will facilitate PWDs in accessing the disability certificate, Govt schemes, assistive aids and appliances and others benefits provided by the government. The project will provide services to all disabilities across all age group. **1. General Information:*** Location: South Delhi (project location)
* Type of Employment: Contractual for a period of 1year, renewable basis project requirements
* No. of Position: 02
* **Reporting to**: Project Manager


**2. Duties & Responsibilities:*** A clinical psychologist is a mental health professional with specialized training in the diagnosis and psychological treatment of wide range of mental, behavioral, and emotional illnesses.
* Focuses on people with more serious mental health issues.
* Treat patients underlying mental health problem and medical disorders.
* Reduce psychological distress and promote psychological well-being.
* Develop and support psychological practices.
* Provide psychological testing and conduct and interpret the assessment.
* Diagnose a disorder and perform psychotherapy and administer the progress
* Record keeping and documentation
* Any other activities given time to time.


**3. Other Indicative Requirements****Educational Qualifications*** PhD/MD/MS/MDS or equivalent degree


OR* MVSc./M. Pharma/ME/M. Tech

 **Functional / Technical Skills and Relevant Experience & Other Requirements (Behavioral, Language, Certifications etc.)*** 3-5 years of research teaching and design & development experience with at least one research paper in science citation indexed (SCI) journal.

 **Working days and Timings:** Monday to Friday, (9:00 am to 5:00 pm) **Holidays:** Monday - Saturday (2 Saturdays off) **Salary:** INR 60,000 - 70,000 per month. (Inclusive of all taxes)  

THF is an equal opportunity employer that encourages women, people with disabilities and those from economically and socially excluded communities with the requisite skills and qualifications to apply for positions. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of caste, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other such matter.

title: Psychologist
description:
applicantsExciting Opportunities, for Psychiatry Trainees (ST1 ST3) at LAS Specialty Registrar

A healthcare organisation in Kent is searching for adaptable individuals to fill fixed term trainee positions providing support for junior doctor rotation gaps. The trust takes pride in its rating from the Care Quality Commission (CQC) with a specific Outstanding rating for its compassionate care.

Job Overview:

Position; Appointment for Service. Trust Grade ST1 ST3 Doctor

Grade; Trust Grade ST1 ST3

Full Time; Fixed term. 40 hours per week with out of hours, on call availability (part time hours will be considered)

Location; East Kent

The trust offers a range of health services throughout Kent. You will be part of a team led by consultants. The trust takes pride in delivering high quality clinical services promoting innovation and collaborating with partners.

Primary Job Responsibilities:

This role provides an opportunity to gain experience in psychiatry at the trainee level while supporting an application for training schemes or Specialty Doctor positions. The duties include:

* Conducting histories and mental state examinations.
* Making diagnoses. Working together on care plans.
* Requesting laboratory investigations and ensuring documentation.
* Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams such as community mental health teams and Crisis Resolution Home Treatment teams.
* Participating in ward rounds MDT meetings and being part of the, on call schedule.

Objectives:

Developing skills in assessing, managing and treating patients in both outpatient settings.

Promoting a patient centered approach to care within a team.

Providing understanding of the factors that contribute to conditions, including biological, psychological and social aspects.

Regarding teaching and training I will deliver lessons to Core trainees, Foundation trainees and GP trainees.

Audit and research of projects aimed at improving services

Candidates must have an MBBS degree or an equivalent medical qualification. Eligibility requires registration with the GMC and a current license to practice. For career progression purposes; providing an employment history along, with demonstrating genuine interest and realistic insight into psychiatry and mental health is essential.

Qualifications; It would be beneficial to have experience, in a community based specialty as well as involvement in extracurricular activities or achievements that have given you a deeper understanding of psychiatry.

Research, Audit and Quality Improvement:

Preferred Qualifications; We value evidence of research accomplishments, as well as participation in an audit project, quality improvement initiative or formal research project. Interest and experience in teaching are also important.

If you are an individual who strives for excellence and is interested in a fulfilling opportunity, in the field of psychiatry we encourage you to apply and join our team. Please make you application via LinkedIn Jobs.

title: Lecturer
description:
Job Description - Lecturer Psychologist cum Admission Counselor

Position Overview:

**YS Public School is a renowned institution known for its commitment to academic excellence, holistic education, and a rich legacy of producing well-rounded individuals. As one of the Top 50 Schools in India, we are dedicated to nurturing young minds and fostering a culture of learning and growth.**

We are seeking a qualified and experienced individual to fill the role of Lecturer Psychologist cum Admission Counselor. The successful candidate will play a dual role, contributing to the academic and psychological development of students, as well as providing guidance in the admissions process.

Responsibilities:

1. Teaching and Academic Support :

- Conduct engaging lectures and seminars in psychology, fostering a positive and inclusive learning environment.

- Develop and deliver curriculum materials aligned with academic standards.

- Provide academic guidance and mentorship to students, addressing their psychological and academic needs.

2. Psychological Counseling

- Offer individual and group counseling sessions to address students' emotional, social, and psychological concerns.

- Implement strategies to enhance students' mental well-being and resilience.

- Collaborate with other faculty members and support staff to create a holistic support system for students.

3. Admission Counseling

- Guide prospective students through the admission process, providing information on academic programs, admission requirements, and campus life.

- Conduct admission interviews and assessments to evaluate students' suitability for the institution.

- Collaborate with the admissions team to streamline the admission process and contribute to the development of admission strategies.

Qualifications:

- Master's or Ph.D. in Psychology or a related field.

- Certification in counseling or clinical psychology.

- Familiarity with admission processes and counseling in an educational setting.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Additional Requirements:

- Empathy, understanding, and a compassionate approach in dealing with students' psychological concerns.

- Strong organizational and time-management skills.

- Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.

This dual role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to both the academic and emotional growth of students while actively participating in the admission process. The ideal candidate will bring a passion for teaching, counseling, and supporting students through their educational journey.

**Perks - Free Accommodation for Single Female Candidates**

title: Counselor
description:
**Job Title**: Psychological Counselor

**Company Name**: Toprankers Edtech Solutions Private Limited

**Job Location**: Bhopal M.P.

**Job Type**: Full-time

**About the Company:** Established in 2016, Toprankers has emerged as India's foremost digital counseling and preparation platform, catering to careers beyond the realms of engineering and medicine. Our mission is to foster awareness and amplify the success rates for promising career paths post-12th grade. We are dedicated to providing superior learning methodologies and comprehensive assistance to each student preparing for management, humanities, law, judiciary, and design entrance examinations.

**Job Description:** 

· We are looking for a compassionate and experienced Psychological Counsellor to support students' mental health and well-being within our EdTech platform. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in psychology, and counseling, and experience working with individuals in educational settings. The Psychological Counselor will play a crucial role in providing virtual counseling services to students, fostering a supportive environment, and promoting mental wellness initiatives.

**Responsibilities:**

· Provide virtual counselling sessions to students enrolled in our EdTech platform, addressing a range of mental health concerns including stress, anxiety, depression, academic pressure, and interpersonal relationships.

· Conduct initial assessments and develop personalized counselling plans tailored to each student's needs and goals.

· Utilize evidence-based therapeutic techniques to facilitate emotional regulation, coping skills, and resilience-building strategies.

· Collaborate with educators and other support staff to identify students in need of psychological support and implement proactive interventions.

· Offer crisis intervention and suicide prevention support as needed, adhering to ethical guidelines and best practices.

· Develop and facilitate psychoeducational workshops, webinars, and resources on topics related to mental health, self-care, and academic success.

· Maintain accurate and confidential records of counselling sessions, assessments, and progress notes in compliance with privacy regulations.

· Stay abreast of current research, trends, and developments in the field of mental health and education, integrating findings into counselling practices and program development.

· Participate in ongoing professional development activities, including supervision, training, and peer consultation.

· Contribute to the development and enhancement of our EdTech platform by providing insights and feedback on features related to mental health and well-being.

**Qualifications:**

· Master's or doctoral degree in counseling psychology, clinical psychology, social work, or a related field from an accredited institution.

· Licensed or license-eligible as a counselor, therapist, or psychologist (e.g., LPC, LCSW, LMFT, or PsyD).

· Minimum of 2-3 years of experience providing counseling services to adolescents or young adults, preferably in an educational or virtual setting.

· Strong knowledge of psychological assessment, diagnosis, and treatment planning.

· Proficient in delivering virtual counseling sessions via video conferencing platforms and maintaining confidentiality in online environments.

· Excellent communication skills, empathy, and cultural competence in working with diverse student populations.

· Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and prioritize competing demands in a fast-paced environment.

· Commitment to ethical standards, confidentiality, and professional boundaries in counseling practice.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

· Experience using teletherapy platforms and digital tools for mental health support.

· Specialization or training in areas such as mindfulness-based interventions, cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), trauma-informed care, or dialectical behavior therapy (DBT).

· Familiarity with educational technology, learning management systems (LMS), and digital interventions for mental health promotion.

title: Practitioners
description:
**"Practitioner"** is a broad term that can encompass various professions and specialties within the healthcare field. Here are descriptions of some common practitioner roles and their typical responsibilities:

* **Nurse Practitioner (NP)**:
* Assess patients' health status through physical examinations, medical history reviews, and diagnostic tests.
* Diagnose and treat acute and chronic illnesses and injuries.
* Prescribe medications and treatments within their scope of practice.
* Order and interpret diagnostic tests, such as lab work and imaging studies.
* Provide preventive care and health education to patients and their families.
* Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare providers to coordinate patient care.
* Manage patients' ongoing healthcare needs and monitor their response to treatment.
* Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records.
* **Physician Assistant (PA)**:
* Conduct comprehensive patient assessments, including medical histories and physical examinations.
* Diagnose and treat common medical conditions under the supervision of a physician.
* Order and interpret diagnostic tests and imaging studies.
* Prescribe medications and treatments as authorized by state laws and physician collaboration agreements.
* Perform procedures, such as suturing wounds and casting fractures.
* Provide patient education and counseling on preventive healthcare and treatment plans.
* Assist in surgery and other invasive procedures as part of the surgical team.
* Participate in patient rounds and collaborate with healthcare team members to optimize patient care.
* **Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner (PMHNP)**:
* Assess patients' mental health and psychiatric conditions through interviews and evaluations.
* Diagnose and treat mental illnesses, including mood disorders, anxiety disorders, and psychotic disorders.
* Prescribe psychiatric medications and monitor their efficacy and side effects.
* Provide psychotherapy and counseling to individuals, families, and groups.
* Collaborate with other mental health professionals, such as psychiatrists, psychologists, and social workers.
* Develop and implement treatment plans tailored to patients' needs and preferences.
* Educate patients and their families about mental health conditions, treatments, and coping strategies.
* Advocate for patients' rights and access to mental healthcare services.
* **Advanced Practice Registered Nurse (APRN)**:
* APRN is a collective term that includes nurse practitioners, clinical nurse specialists, certified nurse midwives, and certified registered nurse anesthetists.
* Assess patients' health status, formulate diagnoses, and develop individualized care plans.
* Provide direct patient care, including prescribing medications, performing procedures, and managing acute and chronic conditions.
* Collaborate with physicians and other healthcare providers to deliver comprehensive care.
* Educate patients and families about health promotion, disease prevention, and self-management strategies.
* Conduct research, quality improvement initiatives, and evidence-based practice projects to advance nursing knowledge and improve patient outcomes.
* Serve as leaders and advocates for patients, communities, and the nursing profession.

title: Clinical Psychologist
company: PRS Neurosciences and Mechatronics Research Institute Pvt Ltd
description:
Job Title: Clinical Psychologist

Job Description:

Position Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and compassionate Clinical Psychologist with a Master's degree in Clinical Psychology to join our team at a Neuro Rehabilitation Centre specializing in the care of neurologically disabled patients. As a Clinical Psychologist, you will play a crucial role in assessing, diagnosing, and treating the psychological and emotional needs of our patients to enhance their overall well-being and quality of life.

Responsibilities:

1. \\*\\*Patient Assessment and Diagnosis:\\*\\*

- Conduct comprehensive psychological assessments to understand the emotional, cognitive, and behavioral aspects of neurologically disabled patients.

- Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to contribute to a holistic understanding of patients' needs.

2. \\*\\*Treatment Planning and Implementation:\\*\\*

- Develop individualized treatment plans based on assessment findings, taking into consideration the unique challenges presented by neurological disabilities.

- Implement evidence-based therapeutic interventions to address emotional and behavioral issues.

- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to integrate psychological interventions into the overall rehabilitation plan.

3. \\*\\*Counseling and Psychotherapy:\\*\\*

- Provide counseling and psychotherapy services to individuals and groups, addressing issues such as anxiety, depression, grief, and adjustment to disability.

- Utilize a variety of therapeutic modalities tailored to the specific needs and abilities of neurologically disabled patients.

4. \\*\\*Behavioral Intervention:\\*\\*

- Design and implement behavior management strategies to address challenging behaviors associated with neurological conditions.

- Collaborate with caregivers and families to provide support and education on managing behavioral issues at home.

5. \\*\\*Patient and Family Education:\\*\\*

- Conduct psychoeducational sessions to educate patients and their families about the psychological and emotional aspects of neurological disabilities.

- Offer coping strategies and resources to enhance overall family functioning.

6. \\*\\*Documentation and Reporting:\\*\\*

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date clinical records in accordance with professional and organizational standards.

- Provide regular progress reports to the interdisciplinary team and participate in case conferences.

7. \\*\\*Research and Continuous Professional Development:\\*\\*

- Stay abreast of the latest research and developments in the field of clinical psychology and neurorehabilitation.

- Engage in continuous professional development activities to enhance and update clinical skills.

Qualifications:

- Master's degree in Clinical Psychology from an accredited institution.

- Licensure or certification as a Clinical Psychologist.

- Experience in working with neurologically disabled populations is highly desirable.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

- Ability to work collaboratively within an interdisciplinary team.

- Compassion, empathy, and a commitment to improving the lives of individuals with neurological disabilities.

If you are passionate about making a positive impact on the psychological well-being of neurologically disabled individuals, we invite you to join our dedicated team at the Neuro Rehabilitation Centre.

title: Psychologist
description:
Psychologist  

**BACKGROUND**
The Hans Foundation, established in 2009, is a Public Charitable Trust that that works for the improvement of quality of life for underprivileged communities across India through Health, Education, Livelihood and Disability sector interventions. THF undertakes direct implementation of projects on the ground in addition to providing funding support to not-for-profit organisations in India through its donor – RIST, USA. THF’s Strategic planning focuses on key areas of its work with the aim of addressing the key issues of poverty alleviation, economic inequalities, and 360° impact on the quality of life through social development programs. THF’s programs are majorly implemented in the most rural and under-developed areas in the country. Over the years, THF has expanded its charitable activities in collaboration with State and Central Governments, institutions, corporates, academia and non-government organizations for sustainable interventions to achieve scale and economy. The interventions implemented by the foundation range from grass root level to national level programs.
**ABOUT PROJECT**
The Hans Wellness Centre (Health services for students) has been conceptualized with a focus on the mental and physical well-being of school students. The health professionals working on this project would be the backbone to steer the project toward the intended impact and the outcomes. The Hans Foundation has started its kind initiative to provide improvement in the physical, mental, and social well-being of school-age children in 24 schools of Delhi NCR, to help towards leading a healthy life. Ensure healthy lives and promote well-being for all at all ages and Sustainable Development and Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all. THF is willing to implement this unique project which is the need of the hour in Govt and private schools of Delhi NCR.  

**Position:** 03**Location:** Delhi NCR (Ghaziabad)

Few points to reflect upon as you apply for this role:
* Psychologist who are passionate to work in the social impact domain and ready to take on grassroots challenges which occur on a daily basis will be preferred.
* The school resources are limited, therefore, Psychologist with “Can Do It” attitude will be a great fit for this opportunity.
* The psychologist will be working in a clinic situated in schools. Work conditions would be different and will have fewer facilities compared to private/govt. clinics.

**Duties & Responsibilities:**
* Carry out assessment and screening
* Conduct individual counselling sessions and group life skill sessions of students for all designated classes.
* Ensure the correct and safe delivery of clinical services to the students.
* Evaluate and report on student progress, maintain the confidentiality of such cases
* Updates the data on App (designed for the project) and keep track of the same)
* Help students to overcome learning disabilities or emotional issues.
* Research new methods to improve children’s well-being.
* Resolve classroom or school crises pertaining to mental health issues.
* Listen to students’ concerns about academic, emotional or social issues.
* Administer and evaluate psychological tests and prepare reports.
* Provide support services to students at all levels.
* Mentor and support teachers of high-risk children.
* Counselling teachers, parents, and caregivers about issues.
* Develop programs to address behaviour issues and learning difficulties.
* Guide parents in facilitating children’s progress.
* Conduct mental health programs in the school
* Homevisits to students’ homes as per the instructions from Project Manager
* Documentation – monthly report, progress deck, case/success stories, SOP.
* Any other work assigned by THF


**Reporting to**: Project Manager, Senior Programme Manager from THF, and Nodal teacher/principal in the school
**Other Indicative Requirements:**
**Educational Qualifications*** Master in Psychology/ Applied Psychology/Counselling Psychology/ Clinical Psychology
* Health Psychology with relevant experience in field of child and adolescent mental health and child counselling.


OR* M. Phil/Phd in Psychology with Masters in Psychology/ Applied Psychology/ Counselling Psychology/ Clinical Psychology/ Health Psychology

**Functional / Technical Skills and Relevant Experience & Other requirements (Behavioural, Language, Certifications etc.)*** Experience of working in field/clinic for 2-3 years
* Current state license
* Candidate must have good communication skills in Hindi & English
* Candidate with prior experience in the social development sector/community-based project would be preferred

  

**Working days and Timings*** Monday - Saturday
* Timings – 08:00 AM to 04:00 PM, (*the timing is subject to change*) 8 hours of duty

**Holidays*** Sundays
* Other Gazetted Leaves (As per the list of THF)

 **Project Location*** Delhi NCR

**Required Skills & Competences:**
* Good working knowledge of principles, methods and procedures for diagnosis and treatment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Behave Politely with children or any other person in school
* Strong understanding of state education policies and regulations
* Effective communication and counselling skills
* Integrity and professionalism
* State license to work as a school psychologist
* In depth knowledge and experience in individual, group and family psychology
* Problem solver and innovative
* Good organizational and time management skill
* Giving close attention to details and demonstrated ability to handle sensitive or confidential information

  


THF is an equal opportunity employer that encourages women, people with disabilities and those from economically and socially excluded communities with the requisite skills and qualifications to apply for positions. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of caste, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other such matter.

description:
The Hans Foundation, established in 2009, is a Public Charitable Trust that that works for the improvement of quality of life for underprivileged communities across India through Health, Education, Livelihood and Disability sector interventions. THF undertakes direct implementation of projects on the ground in addition to providing funding support to not-for-profit organisations in India through its donor – RIST, USA. THF’s Strategic planning focuses on key areas of its work with the aim of addressing the key issues of poverty alleviation, economic inequalities, and 360° impact on the quality of life through social development programs. THF’s programs are majorly implemented in the most rural and under-developed areas in the country. Over the years, THF has expanded its charitable activities in collaboration with State and Central Governments, institutions, corporates, academia and non-government organizations for sustainable interventions to achieve scale and economy. The interventions implemented by the foundation range from grass root level to national level programs.**Background of the Project****Project: Holding hands in magical years: early childhood development & Neuro-rehabilitation Centre.***(A novel multidisciplinary initiative with collaboration of The Hans Foundation & Centre of Excellence and Advanced Research for Childhood Neurodevelopmental Disorders, Child Neurology Division, Department of Pediatrics, AIIMS, New Delhi).*
**The early the better”** believing in this approach, The Hans Foundation has been supporting a number of projects to facilitate the early years of development. It provides supportive services to children and adult with disabilities who more often lack access to the comprehensive and intensified services in those magical years of development and also needed across the lifespan. This approach dramatically improves individual’s chances to reach their full potential and functioning, have better quality of life and take up their right place in the society as adults. The Hans Foundation is creating more such facilities and services in the country to reach the last mile of targeted community while aiming to achieve the goal “***People with disability are enjoying a meaningful life in the inclusive society with high humanistic values”.***

This project would be operated from a Centre established near to AIIMS Delhi for providing array of services: assessment and diagnosis, early intervention, neuro developmental therapies, healthcare and rehabilitation, multidisciplinary interventions which is part of our broader effort to improve the lives of all children and adults with disabilities and to support reforms in the social system. The project will facilitate PWDs in accessing the disability certificate, Govt schemes, assistive aids and appliances and others benefits provided by the government. The project will provide services to all disabilities across all age group.

title: Counselor
description:
* \\***Job Description:**\\*\\*

We are seeking a dedicated Counselor / Psychologist with a Master's Degree in Psychology to join our team at Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre. In this role, you will play a crucial part in helping individuals overcome addiction and regain control of their lives.

\\*\\***Responsibilities:**

**1. Assessment and Evaluation:**

* Conduct thorough assessments to evaluate the psychological and emotional well-being of patients dealing with addiction issues.

2. \\***Individual and Group Counseling:**

* Provide one-on-one and group counseling sessions to address the specific needs and challenges of patients in recovery.

3. \\***Treatment Planning:**

* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary treatment team to develop individualized treatment plans for patients, including setting goals, interventions, and progress monitoring.

4. \\***Crisis Intervention:**

* Respond to crisis situations and provide immediate support and counseling to patients in distress.

5. \\***Education and Prevention:**

* Educate patients and their families about addiction, recovery, coping strategies, and relapse prevention techniques.

6. \\***Documentation:**

* Maintain accurate and confidential records of patient assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and other relevant documentation in accordance with ethical and legal standards.

7. \\***Therapeutic Techniques:**

* Utilize evidence-based therapeutic techniques, such as Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Motivational Interviewing, and Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), to support patients in their recovery journey.

8. \\***Collaboration:**

* Collaborate with medical professionals, social workers, and other staff members to ensure a holistic approach to patient care.

9. \\***Continuous Learning:**

* Stay updated on the latest research and developments in addiction psychology and incorporate best practices into your counseling approach.

\\*\\***Qualifications:**\\*\\*

- Master's Degree in Psychology with a focus on addiction counseling or clinical psychology.

- State licensure or certification as a psychologist or addiction counselor (if required by the state).

- Strong understanding of addiction, substance abuse disorders, and mental health issues.

- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

- Empathy and a non-judgmental approach to patients.

- Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.

- Knowledge of relevant laws and ethical guidelines related to patient confidentiality and care.

- Prior experience in addiction counseling or a similar role is preferred.

title: Psychologist
description:
***Counselling Psychologists: Join us at MCF in making therapy accessible to all!***

**Contract Type:** Full-time, in-person

**Location:** Karvenagar, Pune

**Hours:** Mon-Sat,12-8 pm

**Practical requirements:** Strong counselling skills in Marathi, Hindi and English

**Reports to:** Project Coordinator/Associate

**Application Deadline: 23rd February, 2024**

*Muktaa believes that everyone should be able to receive the right mental health care - wherever and however they need it.* ***We are looking for counselling psychologists for our telephonic mental health helpline.*** *That’s why we’re reaching out to you.*

**A bit about us**

Muktaa Charitable Foundation is a non-profit organisation that has been working on various social issues like HIV/AIDS, addiction, sexual health awareness, gender sensitization and life skill education since 2005. We are now in the second year of our Mental Health Helpline project.

**A brief about the project**

MCF has recently launched a free mental health helpline that provides trauma-informed, culturally responsive, and empathetic care to Indian populations. We provide free, safe, anonymous and non-judgmental mental health support for people going through mental or emotional distress – over the phone. Anyone can feel free to talk to us about their emotions and feelings, how to manage them more effectively and prevent them from overwhelming you.

You can read more about the project here.

**Here is what we’re looking for:**

***Educational Qualifications and Work Experience:***

● a holder of a Master’s in Counselling/Clinical/Applied Psychology from a UGC-recognized University

● a Master’s Student in their **final** semester in Counselling/Clinical/Applied Psychology from a UGC-recognized University (Training structure and duration will vary depending)

● At least 4-6 months of practical counselling experience via work experience or internship (preference for telephonic counselling experience)

● Strong understanding of emotional and mental health struggles of Indian population (especially women, youth, LGBTQIA+, physically ill, low income communities, working professionals)

***Must Haves:***

● based in Pune

● interested in providing free telephonic counselling (through the helpline) to marginalised and vulnerable communities

● fluent in Marathi, Hindi and English

● willing to undergo up to 2-4 months of rigorous training in counselling and role responsibilities. The duration of the training may be adjusted depending on the candidate’s proficiency in learning the required skills.

***Skills:***

● very comfortable using technology and apps to communicate and keep track of things within the team and with clients

● passionate about empathetic, client-centric conversations

● excited about responsibilities like outreach, research, fundraising, project management, training and content creation

● interest in developing a holistic, intersectional and biopsychosocial approach to addressing mental health

● dedicated to this cause for at least 2 years

● good with deadlines, teamwork and open to feedback

● excited to learn and develop new skill sets through regular upskilling sessions

● open to cross-learning from peer-to-peer engagement

**Work Scope**

As our Telephonic Counselling Psychologists, you can look forward to an exciting and challenging career at MCF. In this role, you will be expected to use your industry knowledge, training skills and relevant procedures to therapeutically interact with callers, making them comfortable, understanding the issues they have come to you with and providing the appropriate support towards their mental and emotional well-being. In line with MCF’s holistic approach to team involvement, you will get a chance to be involved in a range of activities, including but not limited to outreach of the helpline’s services, content creation, building of a referral database, fundraising and training as you grow your career with MCF.

**Current work buckets as a telephonic counselling psychologist at MCF:**

***Telephonic Counselling:***

● Actively and supportively listen to the individual's disclosures of emotional distress and provide a safe and holding environment for the same in a telephonic helpline set-up

● Guiding clients in the development of skills or strategies for dealing with their problems

● Assisting callers to identify psychosocial forms of support or to resolve emergency problems in crisis situations

● Collaborate with other staff members and industry experts to develop and implement therapy procedures, strategies and protocols

● Maintaining detailed call records, monthly reports of calls attended

● Maintaining confidentiality of records and follow relevant discretionary protocols while dealing with clients’ cases

***Community Outreach and Stakeholder Engagement:***

● Establish connections and create symbiotic relationships with Non Governmental Organisations (NGOs), public sector social welfare organisations, stakeholders like educational institutes, primary healthcare providers, and community networks for sharing our services and raising awareness.

● Gather information about community mental health needs or resources that could be used in conjunction with therapy.

● Actively participating in brainstorming strategies and execution of Outreach, Awareness and Capacity Building of vulnerable and marginalised communities.

● Creating educational and promotional content surrounding mental health for social media, newsletters, fliers, blogs and articles to help sensitise lay people regarding mental health.

● Delivering talks, skits, training and workshops on topics related to counselling, mental health and psychosocial well-being for increasing awareness.

***Personal and Program Development and Execution:***

● Offering peer supervision and assisting with the onboarding of new counsellors

● Designing and delivering training modules and workshops for academic, government and corporate institutions

● Developing case-studies, research papers and other works of academic writing on MCF’s work

● Work towards building in-person, email, chat and video counselling services at MCF

If this excites you as much as it does us, we’ve been looking for you!

**What you can expect from Muktaa:**

● Continuous skill upgradation through rigorous training

● Building a holistic, value-based and contextually-relevant counselling approach in line with WHO

● A say in developing the project

● Opportunities to grow your skills in networking, counselling, public speaking, training and more

We’re an ambitious, close-knit team. We don’t do mediocre – we’re unashamedly here to support our clients to achieve outcomes that transform their lives. Most of us can’t do it alone – we need an amazing team around us to learn from and share with. At Muktaa, we celebrate our successes and also our efforts, journeys and the friendships we make along the way.

If you’re a therapist looking for more, this is an exciting time to join the Muktaa team. When you are on a mission to help others and make the world a happier and healthier place, work doesn't feel like work but becomes an extension of ourselves!

**If this excites you as much as it excites us, we would love to hear from you!** 

**Send us your CV at hr@mcf.org.in and fill up this Google form, so that we can get to know you better : https://forms.gle/FsRzftDM43hWcMrb8** 

**For any queries, you can Whatsapp us at +91 8390663269** **or write to us at hr@mcf.org.in or shreya.subbannavar@mcf.org.in.** 

We look forward to hearing from you and having some interesting conversations along the way.

Yours,

Dhriti Agarwal

Founder, Mental Health Helpline

Muktaa Charitable Foundation

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
* **Assessment and Diagnosis**: Clinical psychologists conduct interviews, administer psychological tests, and observe behavior to assess clients' mental health status and diagnose any psychological disorders they may have.
* **Treatment Planning**: Based on their assessment, clinical psychologists develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each client's needs. This may involve psychotherapy, behavior modification techniques, or other therapeutic interventions.
* **Psychotherapy**: Clinical psychologists provide psychotherapy to individuals, couples, families, or groups to help them manage and overcome their mental health challenges. They utilize various therapeutic approaches, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT), psychodynamic therapy, or humanistic therapy.
* **Crisis Intervention**: Clinical psychologists may provide immediate assistance and support to individuals experiencing mental health crises, such as suicidal thoughts, acute anxiety, or psychotic episodes.
* **Consultation and Collaboration**: They often collaborate with other mental health professionals, such as psychiatrists, social workers, and counselors, to provide comprehensive care to clients. They may also consult with schools, businesses, or community organizations on mental health-related issues.
* **Research and Evaluation**: Some clinical psychologists engage in research to contribute to the understanding of psychological disorders and effective treatment approaches. They may also evaluate the effectiveness of therapeutic interventions and programs.
* **Teaching and Supervision**: Clinical psychologists may teach courses in psychology at universities or colleges. They may also supervise and mentor psychology students, interns, or other mental health professionals in training.
* **Advocacy and Education**: Clinical psychologists may engage in advocacy efforts to raise awareness about mental health issues, reduce stigma, and promote access to mental health services. They may also provide education and training to the public on topics related to mental wellness and psychological well-being.

Overall, clinical psychologists play a crucial role in helping individuals improve their mental health, cope with life challenges, and achieve greater well-being.

In 1981, Shri Vile Parle Kelavani Mandal (SVKM) established Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS) to meet the growing demand for management education. In 2003, NMIMS was declared a deemed to be university under Section 3 of the UGC Act 1956. The Vision of the University is to be a globally admired University by 2030. The Mission of NMIMS is to emerge as a Centre of Excellence, best in class in India and Asia and yearning to be the best in the world by 2030.


With the legacy of 40 years, NMIMS has grown to being not only one of the top-10 B-schools in India but also emerged as a multi-disciplinary, multi-campus University at Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Indore, Shirpur, Dhule, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Chandigarh and seventeen constituent schools that include Management, Family Business, Engineering, Pharmacy, Architecture, Commerce, Economics, Law, Science, Liberal Arts, Design, Performing Arts, Mathematical Science, Agricultural Science, Hospitality Management, Branding & Advertising and Distance Learning. In addition, we have nine Centres of Excellence as well at the University.


The consistent academic quality, research focus, faculty from top national and global institutes and strong industry linkages at NMIMS have placed it amongst the nation's prime centres of educational excellence and research today. More than 17000 students and about 750 full-time faculty members, 10 faculty members with Fulbright Scholarship and Humboldt International Scholarship for post-doctoral researchers are part of India's most sought after academic community.

title: Social Worker
description:
**Job Opening: Psychiatric social worker**

Sukoon Health is building out India's first healthcare company that services acute Mental Health issues (Inpatient as well as Out-Patient). Sukoon Health will first focus on setting up a 1000+ beds chain for adult inpatient care across India. Over time, the company is expanding into other segments of de-addiction, child development disabilities, dementia care, etc. Sukoon is well-capitalized and seeking to grow rapidly.

Sukoon is Co-Founded by Vidit Bahri and Kanishk Gupta who have successfully operationalized three state-of-the-art facilities in New Delhi. Sukoon is headed by Saleem Asaria as Executive Chairman. Saleem has previously built and listed UK’s largest in-patient mental health care provider chain, Cambian, and prior to that had built and scaled UK’s largest senior living organization.

Sukoon is backed by the investment group Lightrock as the first investment in its upcoming mental holding company to create a global best-in-class mental health platform across the spectrum of care. Lightrock is a leading global impact investing platform specializing in growth-stage investments

About the role We are seeking a Psychiatric Social Worker who will be responsible for providing mental health support and counselling services to patients at Sukoon Recovery Centre. You will work closely within a multidisciplinary team to assess patients' social, emotional, and psychological needs to develop treatment plans and provide ongoing counselling and therapeutic interventions. This role requires a strong understanding of clinical social work principles, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with patients, families, psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, and nurses. Responsibilities

* Conduct thorough assessments of individuals, families, and groups to identify mental health needs and develop appropriate treatment plans.
* Provide individual, family, and group therapy sessions to address emotional, behavioural, and mental health concerns

Implement evidence-based therapeutic interventions to promote positive change and improve patients' overall well-being.

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including treatment plans, progress notes, and relevant documentation in compliance with legal and ethical standards.
* Advocate for patients' rights and access to resources by assisting them in navigating social services, community resources, and entitlement programs.
* Stay updated with current research, best practices, and industry trends in clinical social work, and integrate new knowledge into practice
* Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to develop and implement programs that address community needs and promote mental health awareness.

Requirements and Skills

* Master of Philosophy in Psychiatric Social Work with supervised clinical training.
* Master's degree in Social Work (MSW) from an accredited institution
* Prior experience of working in a psychiatric or addiction treatment setting, preferably in a rehabilitation facility
* Strong knowledge of mental health disorders, substance abuse, and addiction treatment modalities
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to establish rapport with patients, families, and healthcare professionals
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team
* Empathy, compassion, and cultural sensitivity to work with diverse populations

How to apply?

We offer an attractive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and a supportive work environment committed to professional growth and development. If you are passionate about helping individuals on their journey to recovery and possess the necessary qualifications, we encourage you to apply for this rewarding opportunity, kindly reach out at elma.ram@sukoonhealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

title: Psychiatrist
description:
Job Title: Child Psychiatrist (MBBS, MD)

Company: Mind and Brain Hospital

Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka

About Us:

Mind and Brain Hospital is a leading healthcare organization committed to providing high-quality mental health services to our patients. With a team of dedicated professionals, we strive to make a positive impact on the lives of individuals dealing with mental health issues. Our organization values compassion, innovation, and collaboration in delivering personalized care to our patients.

Summary of the Role:

At Mind and Brain Hospital, we offer a comprehensive range of services within our Child Psychiatry department, including Speech Therapy, Behavioral Therapy, and Special Education. These specialized departments are committed to addressing the unique needs of children, providing expert care, and supporting their emotional, behavioral, and educational development. Whether your child requires assistance with communication challenges, behavioral issues, or specialized educational support, our dedicated team is here to help them thrive and reach their full potential. Your child’s well-being and success are at the heart of our mission at Mind and Brain Hospital.

Responsibilities:

Conduct thorough psychiatric evaluations, including patient interviews, medical history reviews, and psychological assessments.

Formulate accurate diagnoses based on collected information and collaborate with the treatment team to develop individualized treatment plans.

Provide expert guidance and recommendations on appropriate medication management for patients requiring pharmacological interventions.

Administer psychotherapy and behavioral interventions to patients, implementing evidence-based treatment modalities.

Monitor patients' progress, making necessary adjustments to treatment plans as required, and regularly reviewing medication efficacy and side effects.

Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as psychologists, social workers, and nurses, to provide holistic care and support to patients.

Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and ethical guidelines.

Stay updated on the latest advancements in psychiatry, attending conferences, seminars, and engaging in continuous professional development activities.

Qualifications:

Medical degree (MBBS) and postgraduate specialization in Psychiatry (MD) from a recognized institution.

Valid license to practice as a Psychiatrist.

Proven experience working as a Psychiatrist, preferably in a clinical setting.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with patients and collaborate with the healthcare team.

Strong diagnostic and assessment skills, with the ability to formulate accurate and comprehensive treatment plans.

Empathy, compassion, and a patient-centered approach to care.

Familiarity with electronic medical record systems and comfortable with using technology in clinical practice.

Success in the Position:

Success in this position entails providing exceptional mental health care to our patients, fostering positive therapeutic relationships, and achieving positive treatment outcomes. As a Psychiatrist, you will contribute to the overall success of our organization by delivering evidence-based care, collaborating effectively with the healthcare team, and demonstrating a commitment to continuous professional growth.

How This Role Fits Into the Organization Overall:

As a Psychiatrist at Mind and Brain Hospital, you will play a vital role in our mission to provide quality mental health services. Your expertise and contributions will directly impact the well-being and lives of our patients. By working closely with our multidisciplinary team, you will contribute to a collaborative and patient-centered approach to care. Your insights and recommendations will help shape our treatment strategies and ensure that our patients receive the best possible care.

If you are a dedicated Psychiatrist passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with mental health challenges, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and be a part of a compassionate and supportive environment where you can thrive both personally and professionally.

To apply, please submit your resume at amrutha@mindandbrainhospital.in and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are interested in this role. We look forward to reviewing your application.

Note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our workforce.

Salary: ₹60,000.00 - ₹100,000.00 per month

* Flexible schedule

Education:

* Doctorate (Preferred)

Shift availability:

* Day Shift (Preferred)

title: Psychologist
description:
The Hans Foundation, established in 2009, is a Public Charitable Trust that that works for the improvement of quality of life for underprivileged communities across India through Health, Education, Livelihood and Disability sector interventions. THF undertakes direct implementation of projects on the ground in addition to providing funding support to not-for-profit organisations in India through its donor – RIST, USA. THF’s Strategic planning focuses on key areas of its work with the aim of addressing the key issues of poverty alleviation, economic inequalities, and 360° impact on the quality of life through social development programs. THF’s programs are majorly implemented in the most rural and under-developed areas in the country. Over the years, THF has expanded its charitable activities in collaboration with State and Central Governments, institutions, corporates, academia and non-government organizations for sustainable interventions to achieve scale and economy. The interventions implemented by the foundation range from grass root level to national level programs.
**Background of the Project****Project: Mobile Community Outreach Rehabilitation for Persons with Disabilities”**

(In collaboration with the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Intellectual Disabilities, Department of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment)
**The early the better****”** believing in this approach, The Hans Foundation has been supporting a number of projects to facilitate the early years of development. It provides supportive services to children and adult with disabilities who more often lack access to the comprehensive and intensified services in those magical years of development and also needed across the lifespan. This approach dramatically improves individual’s chances to reach their full potential and functioning, have better quality of life and take up their right place in the society as adults. The Hans Foundation is creating more such facilities and services in the country to reach the last mile of targeted community while aiming to achieve the goal “***Persons with disabilities are socially included and living a valued & productive life”.***

This project would be operated through mobile bus/van for early intervention, healthcare and rehabilitation, multidisciplinary interventions which is part of our broader effort to improve the lives of all children and adults with disabilities and to support reforms in the social system. The project will facilitate PWDs in accessing the disability certificate, Govt schemes, assistive aids and appliances and others benefits provided by the government.
**1. General Information*** Location: Mumbai
* Type of Employment: Contractual, renewable basis project requirements
* No. of Position: 01
* **Reporting to**: Project Manager


**2. Duties & Responsibilities*** Psychological Assessment and management
* Guidance & Counselling
* Home visits and follow up services
* Behavioural assessment & management
* Mental Health Screening
* Generating Mental health awareness in the community
* Conducting Screening and Identification camps
* Conducting Community training and sensitisation
* Forming support groups in the community
* Record keeping and documentation
* Any other activities given time to time


**3. Other Indicative Requirements****Educational Qualifications*** M.Phil. in Clinical or Rehabilitation Psychology (full time course) from recognised institute,


OR* Master’s degree in psychology with post graduate diploma in Clinical/Rehab psychology


**Functional / Technical Skills and Relevant Experience & Other requirements (Behavioural, Language, Certifications etc.)*** Minimum 3 to 5 years of relevant work experience
* Valid RCI Registration
* Experience with people with disabilities
* Good working knowledge of principles, methods and procedures for diagnosis and treatment
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Behave Politely with children or any other person in school
* Strong understanding of state education policies and regulations
* Effective communication and counselling skills
* Integrity and professionalism
* State license to work as a school psychologist
* In depth knowledge and experience in individual, group and family psychology
* Problem solver and innovative
* Good organizational and time management skill
* Giving close attention to details and demonstrated ability to handle sensitive or confidential information


**Working days and Timings**
Monday – Saturday (2nd and 4th Saturdays off)
Timings – 09:00am to 05:00 pm, 8 hours of duty
**Holidays**: As per THF Holiday List
**Salary**: INR 70,000 – 75,000 per month. (Inclusive of all taxes)

THF is an equal opportunity employer that encourages women, people with disabilities and those from economically and socially excluded communities with the requisite skills and qualifications to apply for positions. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of caste, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other such matter.

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Qualification**

* M. Phil in Clinical Psychology
* RCI Registration
* Experience in clinical psychology, preferably in a child development sector.
* Strong diagnostic and assessment skills.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication abilities.
* Empathy, compassion, and a commitment to ethical and evidence-based practice.

**Job Description**

* Conduct comprehensive psychological assessments to evaluate clients' mental health, emotional, and cognitive functioning.
* Administer standardized assessments and clinical interviews to identify diagnoses and treatment needs.
* Develop personalized treatment plans based on assessment results, client goals, and evidence-based therapeutic modalities.

* Consult and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals, including occupational therapists, speech pathologists, psychologist, social workers, and special educators.
* Provide guidance and support to clients' families and caregivers.
* Participate in team meetings and case conferences to discuss treatment strategies and share expertise.

title: Psychologist
description:
Help us bring our vision of global wellbeing to life
  
  

You will be responsible for collaborating with a multidisciplinary sports team to design and deploy contemporary practices, that promote the emotional and mental wellbeing of a diverse group of athletes. This position will play an important role in ensuring the psychological readiness of professional athletes to engage in high-performance athletic competitions. This is an expert practioner’s role that leverages science and research to enable peak athletic performance; this is an exciting opportunity to join a novel journey of wholistic wellbeing to develop self, society, community and nation!
  
  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Leverage contemporary scientific practices and interventions in the design and management of mental healthcare and emotional wellbeing services for the assigned athletic group
* Collaborate with a multi-functional team of technical coaches and sports science professionals to develop interventions that maximise athletic care; provide consulting support to sports technical team that compliments holistic athletic development
* Lead the formulation, scheduling and delivery of mental and emotional healthcare training programs for individual and group of athletes, during both off and in-season periods
* Research and analyse athletes’ motivation, personality, and performance to improve their self-efficacy through physiological contexts such as biomechanics and kinesiology
* Design and deliver outreach programs, workshops, and psychological / educational group presentations for athletic teams / staff members; provide direct counselling / psychotherapy services to athletes / staff members on both scheduled and need-basis manner
* Participate in physical and technical assessment procedures and provide consulting support to tailor future sports science and technical programmes as per the needs of the athletes
* Collaborate with multidisciplinary stakeholders (technical / sports operations / sports science/ learning centre) to conduct research, analytics, and maintenance of athletes’ profile / performance data; suggest necessary readjustments in future sports science programs; manage data in accordance with relevant legislation, processes and procedures
* Lead by example on being diligent and observant at all times and ensure safety & risk aspects are considered within all sports science programs
* Create a safe and respectable environment for athletes and team members to maximise their holistic development


**Who we’re looking for:**  

* Licensed Psychologist with specialized training in Performance and Sports Psychology; work exposure in professional Football / Hockey preferred
* Relevant clinical / field experience in counselling, psychotherapy, and crisis intervention; ability to manage emotional and mental healthcare needs of both adolescents and adult age groups
* Confident communicator with the ability to enhance an athlete’s performance through attention control training and mind awareness techniques
* High order listening skills with expertise in using breathing, relaxation and/or cognitive techniques to instil focus and mental intensity that is necessary for athletes to increase their performance levels
* Ability to collaborate successfully as part of a multi-disciplinary team to achieve performance and wellbeing objectives
* Ability to communicate information in a manner that is easily understood by a range of audiences Demonstrated skills in building and nurturing trust-based working / client relationships Demonstrated ability to adapt and navigate in an environment of ambiguity and fast paced changes
* A creative thinker, receptive to feedback with willing to learn; one who can successfully navigate and resolve interpersonal conflicts
* An authentic passion to role model and practice the science and art of wholistic Wellbeing


**Why RoundGlass:**  

RoundGlass was built on the vision that wellbeing should be at the very center of our life journey. We are not only reimagining how the world experiences wellbeing, but how companies (like our own) support the wellbeing of their people. We’re a group of talented, socially conscious, gritty, innovators using technology and human energy to create a vibrant wellness ecosystem. Together, we’ve built an amazing community and we are always looking for people who share our passion.
  
  

About RoundGlass Sports
  
  

RoundGlass Sports is transforming sports in the state of Punjab by creating an environment that’s both desirable and equitable, building infrastructure, training and motivation through an Academy and Grassroots program to help players reach their full potential.
  
  

Our focus is on bringing world class standards to RoundGlass Punjab Football Club and The RoundGlass Sports Academy which will support the development of talent in football, hockey and tennis, underpinned by the principles of wholistic wellbeing.
  
  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. title: Psychologist
description:
**\\*\\*Job Title:\\*\\*** De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist

**\\*\\*Location:\\*\\*** Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre

**\\*\\*Job Type:\\*\\*** Full-time

**\\*\\*How to Apply:\\*\\***

Interested candidates should submit their resume, recent photograph and a cover letter detailing their qualifications and motivation for applying to whatsapp on +91-9551000068.

Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply.

**\\*\\*About Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre:\\*\\***

Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre is a leading healthcare facility dedicated to providing comprehensive treatment and support to individuals battling addiction and mental health issues. Our mission is to empower patients on their journey to recovery and offer them the highest quality of care in a compassionate and professional environment.

**\\*\\*Job Description:\\*\\***

We are seeking a dedicated and compassionate De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist with a Master's Degree in Psychology to join our team at Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre. In this role, you will play a crucial part in helping individuals overcome addiction and regain control of their lives.

**\\*\\*Responsibilities:\\*\\***

1. \\*\\*Assessment and Evaluation:\\*\\* Conduct thorough assessments to evaluate the psychological and emotional well-being of patients dealing with addiction issues.

2. \\*\\*Individual and Group Counseling:\\*\\* Provide one-on-one and group counseling sessions to address the specific needs and challenges of patients in recovery.

3. \\*\\*Treatment Planning:\\*\\* Collaborate with the interdisciplinary treatment team to develop individualized treatment plans for patients, including setting goals, interventions, and progress monitoring.

4. \\*\\*Crisis Intervention:\\*\\* Respond to crisis situations and provide immediate support and counseling to patients in distress.

5. \\*\\*Education and Prevention:\\*\\* Educate patients and their families about addiction, recovery, coping strategies, and relapse prevention techniques.

6. \\*\\*Documentation:\\*\\* Maintain accurate and confidential records of patient assessments, treatment plans, progress notes, and other relevant documentation in accordance with ethical and legal standards.

7. \\*\\*Therapeutic Techniques:\\*\\* Utilize evidence-based therapeutic techniques, such as Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT), Motivational Interviewing, and Dialectical Behavior Therapy (DBT), to support patients in their recovery journey.

8. \\*\\*Collaboration:\\*\\* Collaborate with medical professionals, social workers, and other staff members to ensure a holistic approach to patient care.

9. \\*\\*Continuous Learning:\\*\\* Stay updated on the latest research and developments in addiction psychology and incorporate best practices into your counseling approach.

**\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\***

- Master's Degree in Psychology with a focus on addiction counseling or clinical psychology.

- State licensure or certification as a psychologist or addiction counselor (if required by the state).

- Strong understanding of addiction, substance abuse disorders, and mental health issues.

- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

- Empathy and a non-judgmental approach to patients.

- Ability to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.

- Knowledge of relevant laws and ethical guidelines related to patient confidentiality and care.

- Prior experience in addiction counseling or a similar role is preferred.

**\\*\\*Benefits:\\*\\***

- Competitive salary and benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and continuing education.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

- The chance to make a meaningful impact on patients' lives.

If you are a compassionate and dedicated De-Addiction Counselor / Psychologist with a passion for helping individuals on their path to recovery, we invite you to join our team at Rebirth Hospital & Rehabilitation Centre. Together, we can make a difference in the lives of those we serve.

description:
MindTribe by Dr. Prerna Kohli is India's fastest-growing mental health organization. Focused on destigmatization of Mental Health. We offer our clients the following

* Affordable Counseling
* Workshops
* Support Groups
* Communities
* Group Therapy
* eLearning

If recruited you will be involved in all of the activities

We are seeking freshers with a ***minimum*** of **Masters**, MPhil, or Ph.D. in Psychology to join our team.

This role is ideal for those with 0-24 months of work experience (excluding internships)

This is a work-from-home opportunity, you will not be required to come to our offices.

We have a very intense training program during the probationary period, at the successful completion of the probationary period you are confirmed and absorbed as a full-time employee into the company

PLEASE NOTE

* THIS IS ***NOT*** AN INTERNSHIP
* If recruited you can't work anywhere else
* If recruited in the first 12 months you can't join any full-time/part-time degrees, diplomas, or certificates
* At the end of the first 12 months with management approval, you can join part-time educational programs

**About MindTribe:** MindTribe is an initiative of Dr. Prerna Kohli, India’s eminent psychologist. MindTribe provides affordable counseling, support groups, communities, workshops, and eLearning for improving Mental Health.

**About Dr. Prerna Kohli:** Dr. Prerna Kohli ( M.Phil, Ph.D.) is the first Clinical Psychologist to be awarded by the Hon. President of India. She is the founder of MindTribe.in and has been a contributor in the area of mental health for over 27 years. She is a published author, a 4 times gold medalist, an intensive research scholar, and has been an adviser to the National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) and is a member of the Niti Aayog Nutrition Committee.
