title: Psychologist
description:
At Global Discovery School (GDS), we innovate K12 space. We help nation prepare for a superpower status by investing in children. Our big new innovation is to launch the next generation school USP called - THE EMPOWERING SPACE BY PERFORMANCE COACH FOR ACADS & LIFE. It will be created by the scientific understanding of the child, the ecosystem of educators, parents, management and also of school processes & policies deeply rooted in psychology.

Introducing our offering, “Life Mein Marks” (LMM)", going beyond academic performance, unique to each child and accessible to every parent in the country, built towards our efforts to put civilization back on track.

We do not work on clinical cases but on mainstream population - students / parents / staff / management.

We are seeking a qualified and compassionate Psychologist to join our Global Discovery Schools, Sevasi. The successful candidate must have the knowledge and skills to provide quality care to our students, teachers, and guidance to parents and management as well.

Introducing our offering, “Life Mein Marks” (LMM)", going beyond academic performance, unique to each child and accessible to every parent in the country, built towards our efforts of nation-building and shaping the youth of India.

LMM is an evidence-based AI-powered technological platform that acts as an exclusive Guide and an Enabler to identify, understand, and build every child’s physical, psychological, emotional, cognitive, and spiritual self. LMM creates a systematic and efficient communication channel to bridge the gap between parents, family, peers, educators, and experts, each drawing from varied facets of the child’s living experience, at home, in school, and the outside world.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* 80% time on children, 20% time on teachers, parents and school management.
* Openness of mind, willingness and alignement to learn from pre existing success stories in similar space creation efforts including Vipassana, Landmark Forum, Satguru books, and work of famous psychologists who addressed the mainstream population.
* Create power f rom every incidence by helping adults and children distinguish more & more about working of their own mind.
* Comfortable being prominent and visible face of the brand - Empowering Space by Performance Coach
* Willingness to practice the linguistic constructs called ontological "distinctions" on self - creating power out of every incidence, distinguishing what is in existence and practicing putting it in self expression through sharings. Inviting insights from the space. Being an example of looking inside. Maintaining compassion and desire to contribute - all the time.
* Conduct psychological assessments and tests for students
* Educate and recommend engagements and actions to respond to specific behaviour and experiences of the child
* Develop and individualized treatment plan for each child
* Educate family members on what they can do for their child or how to respond to their certain behaviour
* Provide complete documentation and records of assessments
* Guide the development and implement a competitive school counseling program that focuses on and promotes students’ success
* Value and respond to the diversity and individual differences of students
* Ensure equitable access to opportunities and rigorous curriculum for all students
* Provide direct support services through structured conventions
* Provide group or individual responsive services
* Collaborate and consult with parents, teachers, community organizations and other stakeholders
* Perform assessments, interpret tests and study student records
* Gather and analyze data to measure results

**Psychologist Requirements:**

* Masters degree in School Counseling.
* Freshers from top schools and/or with academic edge may be considered.
* Several years practical experience working with children in a clinical setting may be strongly desired
* Must be approachable and emphatic for children to be comfortable working with you
* Excellent communication skills, specifically the ability to communicate with children of different cultural and socio-economic backgrounds
* Proven working experience in school counseling
* Integrity and professionalism
* Advocacy skills
* Ability to respond effectively to the needs of a diverse student pool
* Working knowledge of various counseling models, practices and resources
* Engaging interpersonal skills and excellent communication skills
* Ability to collect and analyze data
* Computer literacy
* Sound judgment and emotional intelligence

**Company Profile**

Global Discovery School, Gotri - Sevasi:

Join an education revolution at Global Discovery School, Gotri - Sevasi - The most promising innovation in education worldwide fundamentally changing how schools are created and operated. GDS promises you a platform to unleash your creativity and rigor, an environment to debate innovation capable of driving a revolution across the sector.

E-mail your resume to jobs@GlobalDiscoveryAcademy.com

We are a research institute that is driving a philosophy called “Life Mein Marks” which is the next generation schooling system of India in line with New Education Policy. It’s coming from deep understanding of Psychology of a child and the changing & strange time we are in.

We provide - Excellent pay, Fun environment, Flex hours, Exposure to renowned Global Management

Join us - A milestone simply too critical to skip. Give shape to your dreams, scale new horizons and drive a revolution in a new era in education. E-mail your resume to jobs@GlobalDiscoveryAcademy.com

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
**Duties and Responsibilities**

Diagnoses or evaluates mental and emotional disorders of individuals and administers programs of treatment; interviews patients in clinics, hospitals, and other settings and studies medical and social case histories.

Observes patients in various situations; selects, administers, and interprets intelligence, personality, or other psychological tests to diagnose disorders and formulate plans of treatment, and provides consultation to other mental health professionals with regard to test results.

Treats psychological disorders to effect improved adjustments utilizing various psychological techniques; selects appropriate treatment approach and plans frequency, intensity, and duration of individual, group, and family therapies.

Assesses patient progress and modifies treatment programs accordingly; communicates with and counsels family members as appropriate.

Documents therapy in accordance with policies and procedures regarding medical records; implements and adheres to policies which ensure patient confidentiality.

Provides crisis intervention in situations requiring immediate psychological treatment.

Participates in educational programs, in-service meetings, clinician meetings, and workshops to enhance professional development and maintain currency of methodology and techniques.

May instruct and direct students serving psychological internships in hospitals and clinics.

Provides psychological consultations to other mental health professionals within hospitals, clinics, and other community based agencies with regard to clients and/or patient care.

May develop and implement clinical research programs.

May serve as Campus Security Authority as outlined by the Clery Act.

Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.

Psychiatrists evaluate, diagnose, and treat patients with mental, emotional, and behavioral disorders. They conduct thorough psychiatric evaluations, develop treatment plans, prescribe medication, and evaluate treatment results. Psychiatrists can work in a variety of settings, including hospitals, private practices, clinics, and nursing homes.


Psychiatrists are required to complete extensive education. Psychiatrists must have a medical degree from an accredited medical school, complete a residency program in psychiatry, be board certified in psychiatry, and be licensed to practice medicine in the state of practice. Licensure requirements vary by state, but usually involve taking an exam that specifically includes regulations unique to the state of practice.


The best psychiatrists are very perceptive, have strong listening skills, and are excellent critical thinkers.


Responsibilities for Psychiatrist
* Assess and screen patients by conducting psychiatric evaluations, including interviews, medical histories, physical exams, observations, and psychological testing.
* Analyze data and results of assessments to diagnose patients.
* Prescribe and administer medications according to diagnosis.
* Monitor patients to determine efficacy and potential side effects of medications.
* Develop a treatment plan, measure progress against the plan, and make adjustments as needed.
* Provide crisis intervention as needed.
* Complete all necessary clinical documentation in an accurate and timely manner.
* Collaborate with a broader team of physicians, psychologists, and nurses to assess and adjust treatment plans.
* Coordinate and communicate with case managers and other stakeholders about treatment and care.

Qualifications for Psychiatrist
* Current and valid board certification in psychiatry.
* Medical degree from an accredited medical school and completion of an approved psychiatric residency.
* Prescribe and administer medications according to diagnosis.
* Licensed to practice medicine in state of practice.
* Current DEA registration.
* Excellent knowledge and familiarity with current DSM criteria.
* Familiar with crisis assessment tools and techniques.
* Strong working knowledge of general psychiatric principles and practices.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
At Heart It Out, we care! We strive to provide accessible mental healthcare for all. This vision comes to life through skilled and compassionate individuals like you.
  

We are committed to making mental healthcare accessible to 1.5 billion people across India. Our therapeutic services, products, and events are carefully curated to cater to the community's mental health care needs.


The role of Clinical Psychologist would require you to meet with our clients and work with them to sort out any emotional or motivational issue that may arise. This role would also require you to work with the clients to identify problems, if any, in emotional, mental and behavioural areas and follow with therapy and adequate support.


Masters Degree in Clinical psychology or Mphil Degree in Clinical psychology or Doctorate in Clinical psychology.
Analytical and Scientific approach coupled with Lateral thinking.
Ability to observe, assess, and record symptoms, reactions, and progress.
Interviewing and psychological/ developmental evaluation skills.
Ability to evaluate the progress of therapeutic programs and to make individual modifications.
Knowledge of psychological test administration, scoring, and interpretation.
We appreciate individuals who can take on initiative and responsibility.
We appreciate individuals who can take on initiative and responsibility.
Apply relevant current special education methodologies and techniques.
Knowledge of crisis intervention techniques.


Ability to effectively communicate medical information, test results, diagnoses and/or proposed treatment in a manner easily understood by the client.
Ability to maintain emotional stability to cope with human suffering, emergencies, and other stresses.
Skill in preparing and maintaining detailed records.
Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing.
Compassion, empathy and cultural sensitivity.


Being non-judgemental and professionalism are much appreciated.
Diagnose and evaluate mental and emotional disorders and provide counseling, psychotherapy and follow-up care.
Formulate plans of treatment, and provide referral to other mental health professionals based on assessments.
Provide crisis intervention in situations requiring immediate psychological treatment.
Participate in educational programs, in-service meetings, clinician meetings, and workshops to enhance professional development.
Instruct and direct students serving psychological internships.
Develop and implement clinical and non clinical research programs.
Develop, manage and implement mental health projects in collaboration with other professionals.
Maintain a social and medical profile on the Internet and different social media platforms.
Attend and participate in peer supervision, and continuous learning.
Evaluate future potential psychologists that enter the ecosystem.
Consults with other therapists and related professional and paraprofessional staff in the performance of therapeutic & managerial roles and casework.
  
Competitive Compensation


Flexible Hours


Home Office Option


Generous Holiday


Feel Invested


Office Parties & Outings


Birthday Gifts


Pet Friendly Office

* Supervising them on their work-related stress.
* Taking the training classes for psychologists and trainees of MindPlus retreat and MindPlus.
* Making plans for further up-gradation of psychological services. These are the core areas.
